loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 50 years old and married with four children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, sugar, cereals, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Rosemarie has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, sugar, cereals, and detergent soap to sell

loans.name: Jenelita

texts.en:
Jenelita is 43 years old and married. 

Jenelita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenelita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jenelita has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jenelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jennylie

texts.en:
Jennylie is 22 years old and has one child. She has one child in school.

Jennylie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jennylie has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Jennylie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emelie is 39 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Emelie has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Emelie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Emelie has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Emelie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Herminia is 57 years old and has two children are still in school.

Herminia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Herminia requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish nets, bamboo and do maintenance on her boat.

Herminia has been in this business for 25 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets, bamboo and do maintenance on her boat.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens, food vending and a general store. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell on her vegetable stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell on her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 54 years old and has four children. Lourdes is married and has one child who is still in school.

Lourdes is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lourdes has been in pig-fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
As a single parent of seven children, Rhodora works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rhodora is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  purchase sacks of flour, sugar and other supplies and materials for her bakery business.

Rhodora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, sugar and other supplies and materials for her business.

loans.name: Azenith

texts.en:
Azenith is 33 years old and married. Azenith works very hard to provide for them.

Azenith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries.

Azenith has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Azenith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Delita

texts.en:
Delita is 40 years old and married with two children.

Delita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Delita has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut wine.

Delita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Edelberto

texts.en:
Edelberto is 58 years old and married with two children. Edelberto works very hard to provide for them.

Edelberto runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, home product care items and other groceries.

Edelberto has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Edelberto would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, home product care items and other groceries.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is a woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emelie is 36 years old and has one child in school.

Emelie has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like clothes, etc.

Emelie has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Emelie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like clothes.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 56 years old, a married woman and has six children.

Rosario is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Rosario requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, sacks of feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosario has been in business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, sacks of feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
Emmalyn is 37 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Emmalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like beverages, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Emmalyn has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Emmalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like beverages, condiments, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat is a resident of a rural area located in Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. She is aged 26 years old and is a married mother of a dependent child who is still too young to go to study. 

For 8 years, the main source of her family income has been from rice farming. To earn more income to support her family, she also works as a construction worker as well. She can earn around 44,000KHR and save around 22,000KHR for when needed. 

Sophat has been with VisionFund Cambodia for one cycle already and completely repaid the loan. The first loan helped her to have a better living condition, and now she is applying for this new loan in order to buy a motorcycle for going to work. She hopes that the loan will help her to have a standard of living and ability to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is 32 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $ 1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $ 70. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, fish, milk, oils, water, biscuits, books, soap and shampoo. She is a very hard-working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 15 years. 

She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, fish,milk, oils, water, biscuits, books, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Josael Salvador

texts.es:
Josael, de 23 años de edad, es comerciante, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, debido a los escasos recursos de su familia; está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al trabajo domestico, solo tiene un hijo un año de edad.

Josael, se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace tres años, este oficio lo aprendio debido a la escases de tabrajo que existe, su lugar de trabajo está ubicado a dos kilómetros desde su casa.

Josael, con el crédito que solicita comprará novillos de repasto, para cuidarlos y venderlos cuando ya esten grandes y asi obtener buenas ganancias, para suplir las necesidades de su familia.

El sueño de Josael, es tener una buena cantidad de ganado de repasto, para iniciar en el negocio de la ganaderia, todo con el fin de proporcionarle todo lo necesario a su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Josael is 23 years old and a businessman He completed his schooling through his first year of high school. He was unable to go any further due to his family's lack of economic resources. He has a girlfriend who works in the home and he also has a one year old son.

Josael has sold bread for three years, a trade he learned because there are few other trades to choose from. He works about 2 kilometers from his home.

Josael would like to ask for a loan in order to purchase young grazing livestock so he can raise them and sell them when they reach maturity and in this way earn the money he needs to support his family.

Josael's dream is to have a good quantity of livestock and to start a livestock business, with the ultimate goal being able to economically support his small family.

loans.use: purchase grazing livestock.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, de 45 años de edad, estudio unicamente hasta sexto grado, no siguio estudiando porque prefirio trabajar en el campo; asi que se dedico a aprender la agricultura y la ganaderia, está acompañado y junto a su pareja tiene tres hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos ya son independientes y el ultimo aún sigue estudiando.

Juan, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganaderia desde la edad de 11 años, en compañía de sus padres la realizaba, luego se dedico por completo a la agricultura, cuando formo su hogar, su trabajo está a dos kilometros de su casa.

Juan, necesita el crédito para comprar una novilla de repasto, para que pueda reproducirse y genere más ganancias.

Juan, sueña con poder darle una buena educación a su ultimo hijo, para que el pueda ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old and only studied up to the sixth grade. He did not continue his studies because he preferred to start working. This is how he learned the trades of agriculture and cattle raising. He is married and he has three children. Two of them are already grown and independent but the youngest is still in school.

Juan has worked in agriculture and livestock since he was 11 years old. He went to work with his parents who were also in these trades. When he started his own family, he shifted all of his efforts to agriculture. His work is two kilometers from his home.

Juan needs a loan in order to purchase a young cow so he can breed her and earn more income.

Juan dreams of being able to give a good education to his youngest son so that he can one day have a professional career.

loans.use: purchase a young cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay medical bills for her surgery for uterine tumors as well as to help her pay for her medicines.

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es: Ana de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas su negocio está ubicado cerca de su casa tiene 20 años de dedicarse a ese negocio, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 49 years old and she lives in her own home with her husband and son. She makes a living selling tortillas and her business is located near her home. She has been working in this trade for nearly 20 years, which has allowed her to earn enough money to cover some of her household costs.

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase corn wholesale, as well as purchase lime, in order to continue making tortillas. This will help her earn more money and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase corn wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix her husband's lathe machine.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eugenia is 44 years old and has one child in school.

Eugenia has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Eugenia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Eugenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Delia is 45 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Delia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Delia has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Seann's Group

texts.en:
Seann is 57 years old. She is a married mother of three children and one of them is a dependent child that she needs to look after. She is originally from a rural area located in the Bovel district of Battambang province. The main source of her family’s income has been generated from rice farming for 10 years. To be a better support for her family and earn more income, she also feeds chickens to sell as well. She could earn around 49,000 KHR per day for her family’s needs.

This is the second loan for Seann’s group, which consists of two members with Kiva's partner, VisionFund Cambodia. The previous loan helped her to have enough food to eat and support her family's daily needs. Now she is leading this group to apply for a microloan again using her portion to buy seeds and chicken food and pay for labor. She hopes that through this loan, her family will earn more income and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Christe

texts.en:
Christe is 27 years old and a married woman with one kid. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Christe has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like bread, soft-drinks and other groceries.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Christe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Casiana

texts.en:
Casiana is 58 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Casiana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future, Casiana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 57 years old and married with two children.

Francisca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Francisca has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from sewing. Francisca aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Oysara

texts.en:
Oysara is a generous woman who was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1959. She lives in a rural area with her big family. Oysara is married and has six children. She is a hardworking, responsible and kind person. 

Oysara has 31 years of experience in the agriculture business. She knows her activity well and loves to do agriculture. She likes to work with IMON and hopes to continue their relationship. Oysara is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to buy calves. She wants to have a good business keeping and trading livestock. Oysara awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 61 years old, is married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 4 years, Rosita has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from raising chickens. 

Rosita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as eggs, bread, canned goods, soft drinks, juice, candies, etc. to sell. Rosita has previously borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as eggs, bread, canned goods, soft drinks, juice, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Charona

texts.en:
Charona is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is 26 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Charona has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Charona has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Eutquia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Eutquia works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Eutquia is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell for her business.

Eutquia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Emilda requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Emilda has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Moanah Marie

texts.en:
Moanah Marie is 35 years old and married with three children. With her three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Moanah Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Moanah Marie has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as bread, detergent soap, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, fabric conditioners, etc.

In the future, Moanah Marie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en:
Khursheda is a hardworking woman who is confident, goal oriented, and hospitable. She lives in the northern part of Tajikistan in a small village. She is married and has three children.

Khursheda is a seamstress and sews national dresses for women. She has 10 years of practice sewing at home. She has permanent clients and attracts her customers with dresses of modern designs. She loves her activity and serves women. 

Khursheda wants to have a better standard of living and would like to plant agricultural products on her land. It would help her to earn some additional money to live on. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is a 33-year-old married woman with three children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store.

Cristy has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 33 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as rice, dried fish, home care products, and other groceries.

Helen has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as rice, dried fish, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old, and her two children are in school.

Lydia has a barbershop business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed, such as combs, etc.

Lydia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed, such as combs, etc.

loans.name: Maria Chona

texts.en:
Maria Chona is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Chona is 45 years old, and her child is in school.

Maria Chona has a boarding house rental business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF for the maintenance of the house.

Maria Chona has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her boarding house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband purchase tools, cast iron and spare parts to work with the lathe machine.

loans.name: Lin's Group

texts.en:
Lin, 23 years old, is a local farmer from the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is a married woman with a dependent child. Lin grows cassava as her main source of income. She also works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Lin has been involved in this job for 3 years and it earns her family about 34,400 KHR per day. 

This is Lin's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the leader of this group of four. Lin will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her farmland to get more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 52 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lorna has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and materials for her business.

Lorna has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and materials for her food vending business.

loans.name: Mica

texts.en:
Mica is 32 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mica has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed from NWTF six times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Martinha

texts.en:
Martihna is taking a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as coffee, sugar, biscuits, oils, slippers, cigarettes, books, water and milk.

Martihna opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $400. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, biscuits, oils, slippers, cigarettes, books, water and milk

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng, a farmer living in the Chol Kiri District of Kampong Chnang province, is 42 years old. She is the mother of three children. All of her children are dependent on her and still in school.

For a living, she grows rice on two hectares of farmland as her main source of income. Sometimes she works for others for a fee to supplement her income.

This is her fourth time borrowing with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loans. She will spend her entire loan to pay tution fees for her son who wants to pursue a Bachelor’s degree, majoring in General Management. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay tution fees for her son who wants to pursue a Bachelor’s degree, majoring in General Management

location.town: Kampong Chnang Province, Chol Kiri District

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in the Kratie District of Kratie Province, Ry is 26 years old. She is a married woman with three children. They are all dependent on her and too young to attend school.

She and her family struggle for a living via growing rice as their main source of income. To supplement her income, she grows vegetable plants. This is her third time borrowing with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loans.

In this group of three members, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticide for her rice farm. She hopes that she can expand her current business to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticide for her rice farm

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Savy is 49 years old and a widowed mother of three independent children. She resides in a rural area located in the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province. The main source of her family’s income is potato farming; and to earn more income, she also sells groceries.

Savy’s group consists of two members, and she has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one cycle already and has completely paid back the loan. Now she is leading the group to borrow this second loan; and with her portion, she will buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming. 

The first loan helped her to have better living conditions and enough food to eat. She hopes that in the future she will be able to earn more income and that her family will have a better standard of living

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 24 years old and has one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, candies, home care products, and other groceries.

Mildred has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, candies, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es:
José, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y su esposa estudio hasta cuarto grado y se dedica a las tareas domesticas y no tienen hijos.

José, se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, por tal razón conoce a perfección el trabajo de la agricultura, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió por necesidad, porque son pocas las oportunidades de trabajo que existen; también se dedica a la venta de pan por las mañanas, su trabajo está a dos kilómetros y medios de su casa y viaja en motocicleta.

Con el crédito que está solicitando, comprará abono, semilla de maíz, veneno, pagará alquiler de tierra y la mano de obra para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de tierra.

El sueño de José, es poder comprar un terreno, para construir su casa de ladrillo y darles un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
José, age 32, went to school through the sixth grade.  He is married, and his wife went to school through the fourth grade.  She devotes herself to the household chores.  They do not have children.

José has worked in agriculture since he was very young.  That is why he knows agricultural work to perfection.  Everything he knows, he learned from necessity because few work opportunities exist.  He also sells bread in the mornings.  His work is two and a half kilometers from his house, and he gets there by motorcycle.

He will use the loan he is requesting to buy compost, corn seeds, and weed killer.  He will also pay to rent the land and pay for the labor to plant 7,000 square meters of land.

José’s dream is to be able to buy land in order to build his house from brick and to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy compost, corn seeds, and weed killer and to pay to rent the land and for the labor to plant 7,000 square meters of land.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of a country and lives in a rural area. She is married and has two children.

Mahbuba is a capable, responsible, and generous person. She has eight years experience doing business and serving people. She is a seamstress and sews national dresses for women. Mahbuba attracts clients with her beautifully designed dresses and has permanent satisfied customers. 

She wants to buy a sewing machine so that she can work more productively, and she is asking for a loan for this purpose. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Deisis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Daisis, de 50 años de edad, estudio unicamente hasta segundo grado, no pudo seguir estudiando porque sus padres fueron personas de escasos recursos economicos, está acompañada y es madre de cuatro hijos, todos ya son independientes.

Daisis, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganaderia desde la edad de los 12 años en compañía de sus padres y despues de acompañarse, decidio hacerlo junto a su compañero de vida.

Daisis, solicita el crédito para comprar una yunta de novillos de repasto, para cuidarlos y en un año venderlos para poder incrementar sus ganancias e ir aunmentando su hato de ganado.

El sueño de Daisis, es mejorar su negocio y aumentar su crianza de novillos de repasto, para poder algún día contruir su casa de ladrillo.
texts.en:
Daisis is 50 years old and attended school only until the second grade. She could not continue studying because her parents had very limited economic resources. She has a partner and is the mother of four children. All of them are already independent. Daisis has been working in agriculture and with cattle since she was 12 years old with her parents. After getting a partner, she decided to do this work with her partner in life.

Daisis is requesting the loan to buy a pair of  young grazing cattle, care for them and sell them after a year, to be able to increase her revenue and to increase her herd.

Daisis’ dream is to improve her business and raise more grazing cattle to be able to build a brick house some day.

loans.use: to buy a pair of young grazing cattle.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
Marcos, de 57 años de edad, estudio unicamente hasta tercer grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica al oficio doméstico, juntos han procreado cinco hijos, de los cuales tres de ellos son independientes y unicamente dos dependen de ellos.

Marcos, tiene treinta años de dedicarse a la agricultura, debido aque no encontraba trabajo en ningún lugar, decidió trabajar jornalero y fue asi como aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura.
 
Marcos, solicita el préstamo para comprar cinco sacos de abono, semilla, insumos, preparar la tierra y pagar mano de obra, para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maiz.

El sueño de Marcos, es poder comprar un terreno de 7,000 metros cuadrados, para poder trabajar en la agricultura y no tener que pagar alquiler de tierra.
texts.en:
Marcos, age 57, only went to school through the third grade.  He is married, and his wife devotes herself to the household chores.  They have five children.  Three of them are independent, and only two are dependent upon them.

Marcos has been working in agriculture for 30 years.  Because he did not find work anywhere, he decided to work as a day worker.  This is how he learned to work in agriculture.

Marcos is requesting the loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer, seeds, and supplies to prepare the land.  He will also pay for the labor to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

Marcos’s dream is be able to buy 7,000 square meters of land in order to be able to work in agriculture and to not have to pay rent for the land.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer, seeds, and supplies to prepare the land and to pay for the labor to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 39 лет, замужем, она счастливая мама 3 детей. Образование- среднее. В хозяйстве Гульмиры есть корова, 7 овец, 1,0 Га земли, где она выращивает арбузы для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян для парника и минеральных удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистой продукции. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulmira is 39 years old, married, and the happy mother of 3 children. She has a secondary education. Gulmira has a cow, 7 sheep, and 1.0 hectare of land on her farm, where she grows watermelon to sell. In order to further develop her business, Gulmira has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds for a greenhouse, and to buy mineral fertilizers so that she can cultivate her land and grow organic produce. Gulmira plans to put the proceeds from her loan toward the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds for a greenhouse, and fertilizers for land cultivation and growing organic watermelons

loans.name: Srun's Group

texts.en:
Srun is originally living in a rural area located in the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province. She is 52 years old and a married mother of two children, one of whom is a dependent child and is still in school.

The main source of her family's income is potato farming for 10 years; and to earn more income to better support her family, she works for another farm as well.

This is the fourth loan with VisionFund for Srun’s group, which consists of two members. As a group leader, she leads the group to take this loan and will use her portion to buy seeds and pay for labor to work on her farm. 

The previous loan helped her family to have enough food to eat and enabled her to send her child to school. She hopes that her family's income and standard of living will keep increasing.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor

loans.name: Sokheang's Group

texts.en:
Sokheang, 21, is a married woman living in the Keo Seima district of Mondulkiri province. To make a living, she and her husband grow cassava and repair motorbikes as their main sources of income. She and her husband also work as paid workers to supplement their family’s income.

This is her second time borrowing with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loan. She leads this group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion on fertilizers and to prepare the farmland to grow cassava.

She hopes that she can expand her current business to earn more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to prepare her farmland to grow cassava

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace mas de 7 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Sonia is 48 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and daughter. She has been working in the sale of personal care products for more than 7 years. Her business is located in her house, and the earnings from the sales go toward paying for some of the costs of her home.  Sonia is asking for a loan for the purchase of perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorant, etc. at wholesale prices and thus be able to continue with her work to obtain a better income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deoderants and so on at wholesale prices

loans.name: Osmin Evelio

texts.es: Osmin de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros, tiene más de 20 años de experiencia en la actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Osmin esta solicita un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa interior diferentes estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Osmin, 58 years old, lives in his own home with his family. He makes a living selling men and women’s undergarments, and he has more than 20 years of experience in the business – which he started with his own equity. 

He has many regular customers with which he keeps his business afloat. With the profits he earns from his sales, he is able to cover some household expenses.  

Osmin is asking for a loan in order to buy a greater quantity of undergarments of different styles and colors, and thus have more customers and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of undergarments of different styles and colors.

loans.name: Seinegul

texts.ru: Сейнегул, 51 год, замужем, есть сын школьник. Образование у Сейнегул высшее, работает в РОВД района, в качестве дополнительно дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1990 году. Благодаря упорному труду Сейнегул, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется корова, 5 овец, на участке мерою 1,17 Га она выращивает фасоль. Ее ежемесячный совокупный доход - около 31,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сейнегул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетелей и 5 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Seinegul is 51 years old, married, and has a son in school. Seinegul has a post-secondary education and works in the region's Regional Department of Internal Affairs. As an extra source of income for her family, Seinegul practices field and animal husbandry, which she started doing in 1990. Because of Seinegul's hard work, she now has a cow, 5 sheep, and 1.17 hectare plot of land where she grows beans. Her monthly combined income is around 31,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her business, Seinegul has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of 2 heifers and 5 sheep. She plans to use the profits from the loan for the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy two heifers and five sheep to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 59 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Narcisa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like biscuits, condiments, and other groceries.

Narcisa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. Her goal is to save enough to provide future financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like biscuits, condiments, and other groceries

loans.name: Eap's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Eap is 49 years old. She has two dependent children. For a living, she grows rice and cassava as her main sources of income. In order to supplement income, she works for others for a fee. She has been involved in these jobs for 30 years, and she can earn about 30,200 KHR per day.

This is her second time borrowing with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loan. As the leader of her group of three members, she will spend her loan portion to plow the farmland and buy fertilizer for cassava. She hopes that she can improve her farmland to get more yields.

loans.use: to plow her farmland and buy fertilizer for cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Berveli Irene

texts.es: Berveli de 51 años vive con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mas de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio por esa razón tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Berveli is 51 years old and lives with her husband and son. She owns a bakery located in her place of residence. She has more than 15 years experience in the business and for this reason she has many clients who appreciate the way she makes bread. With the earnings that she obtains, she is getting ahead with household expenses. Berveli is asking for a loan for the purchase of flour, sugar, jellies of different flavors, pans and so on to be able to continue with her work and have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, jellies, pans, etc.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.es: Adelita de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con el esposo, ella posee un comedor y tienda ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene 15 años de tener su negocio el cual le ayuda para poder salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos para su negocio como: refrescos, gaseosas, carnes, pollos,  verduras, frutas, etc. y así poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Adelita is 50 years old and lives with her husband in their own house. She has a small eatery and store located in her place of residence. Adelita has had her business for 15 years and it helps her get ahead with household expenses. She is asking for a loan for the purchase of products for her business, such as sodas and bottled drinks, meat, chickens, greens, fruits and so on, so that she can continue her sales, have a better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bottled drinks, sodas, meat, chicken, green vegetables, fruits and so on.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This entrepreneur's name is Imelda. She is 46 and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, a tricycle driver, and has three children, one of whom is in high school; the other two are still at the elementary level. She manages her household while operating a number of businesses to augment their income, to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her children to school. 

Imelda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She is also a retailer of liquid petroleum gas (LPG) in her town and has a tricycle unit for transport service as well, which her husband drives for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 a day. 

To help her continue operating her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, and biscuits, as well as LPG, to sell at her store. She is positive that this loan will boost her income as she expands her business. Her income is their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Imelda hopes to maintain and grow her business. She wants all of her children to get a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship group* to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and liquid petroleum gas to sell.

loans.name: La Florida Group

texts.es: El grupo  “La Florida” está  conformada por 06 mujeres emprendedoras, siendo la gran mayoría de ellas vecinas de la zona. Rosa una de las integrantes es soltera. A sus 22 años de edad Rosa se siente feliz pues  ha logrado poner un pequeño negocio de venta de productos cosméticos de belleza, lo cual lo realiza por catálogo. Negocio que le ha generado ingresos para su hogar. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de talcos, perfumes, colonias. Su mayor deseo es de poder estudiar una carrera universitaria. El grupo “La Florida” agradece el crédito brindado, pues hace posible su progreso. Rosa se encuentra de pie es la primera del lado derecho de la parte posterior. Viste polo blanco con flores.
texts.en:
The La Florida group is composed of six entrepreneurial women, most of whom are neighbors.

Rosa, one of the members, is single. At age 22, she is happy to have set up a small business selling cosmetic products. She sells from catalogs. This business has generated income for her home.

With the loan, she will purchase powders, perfumes, and colognes.

Rosa's greatest wish is to pursue a college degree.

The group is grateful for this loan since it is making their progress possible. In the photo above, Rosa is standing on the right, wearing a white top with a floral print.

loans.use: to buy powders, perfumes and colognes.

loans.name: Jose Hilario

texts.es: Jose de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 36 años, experiencia que le ha dado la oportunidad de vender una buena calidad de producto por esa razón posee clientes fijos, el está solicitando un crédito ya que necesita comprar las herramientas necesarias para continuar con su trabajo como: trasmallos, redes entre otras cosas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y de ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose, 50, lives in his own house with his life partner and their son. He has made a living from traditional fishing for 36 years. This experience has given him the opportunity to sell good quality products and because of this he has regular customers. 

Jose is requesting a loan because he needs to buy the necessary tools to continue his trade such as trammel nets, nets and other supplies since this is his only source of work and income.

loans.use: to buy trammel nets, nets and other supplies.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, debido a los escasos recursos de sus padres, está casado y su esposa se dedica a las tareas domesticas y no tiene hijos.

Luis, desde que dejo de estudiar, se dedico a la agricultura juntamente con sus padres, especialmente a la siembra de maíz, para comercializarlo en elote, sus cultivos están a dos kilómetros de su casa.

Luis, solicita el crédito para comprar dos sacos de abono, insumos agricolas y pagar mano de obra para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

El sueño de Luis, es poder un día sembrar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, para que le genere buenas ganancias para ayudar al desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 47 years old and studied until the fourth grade because his parents had limited resources. He is married and his wife takes care of the household chores. He does not have children. Ever since Luis stopped going to school he has worked in agriculture with his parents, especially growing corn to sell on the cob. The crops are two kilometers from his house. 

Luis is requesting the loan to buy two bags of fertilizer, farming supplies and to pay manual labor to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

Luis’ dream is to be able, one day, to plant 21,000 square meters of corn to generate good profits to help his family.

loans.use: to buy two bags of fertilizer, farm supplies and to pay manual labor to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 36-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 

She has been running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing goods to sell from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting an increase in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her first loan cycle with BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: a loan helps Zarina to purchase merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Amigas De Lucciola  (Santa Ana) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Amigas De Lucciola.
Este es un grupo de 11 mujeres y 2 varones  que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios, se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Juliana, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 6, 4 y 2 años  de edad, dos de ellos  estudian en escuela  y jardín de infantes. El marido es albañil. 
Doña Juliana es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado salir adelante por sus propios medios y ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días unas tres o cuatro  horas al día más que todo en horas de la mañana ya que aprovecha que sus hijos están en clases a esa hora, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Ella va a utilizar este crédito para comprar ropa para la venta para obtener mejores  ganancias que le sirvan para ir de a poco mejorando su calidad de vida, ella agradece mucho estos créditos ya que de esta forma podrá mejorar su negocio y su situación económica.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo,  perfumes, cremas, cosméticos bisutería, entre otras cosas. Este es su primer ciclo en el grupo y espera seguir por muchos años más. Sus sueños darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Ana, known for its lovely natural environment and its beautiful fresh water swimming pools , the members of the credit group Friends of Lucciola get together every two weeks. This is a group of 11 women and 2 men who decided to unite some time ago to form this credit group, which has been very helpful to them since they have been able to improve their small businesses with their loans. The members work in different activities such as general sales and services, among others. One of the members is señora Juliana, 24 years of age who is in a free union and has three children of 6, 4, and 2 years. Two them are in school or in kindergarten. Her spouse is a bricklayer.

Doña Juliana is a woman who has always enjoyed getting ahead by her own means, and she helps her husband with household expenses. She works in the sale of Belcorp products (beauty and cosmetic products, perfume and accessories for ladies). She sells door to door and goes out nearly every day for three or four hours, especially during the morning, taking advantage of the time when her children are in school. She sells her products on credit and collects every week. She will use this loan to buy clothing to sell to obtain more income, which will help her to better her family’s quality of life little by little. She appreciates these loans, since she will be able to improve her business and her economic situation. This loan will enable her to buy many types of clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and costume jewelry, among other things. She is in her first loan cycle in the group and she hopes to continue for many more years.  Her dreams are to provide the best for her children. (The small photo is of a group member who was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.)

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Virgen De Guadalupe se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi,  ciudad conocida por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla. Este Grupo está integrado por 11 mujeres y 1 varón que al enterarse de los beneficios que brinda la institución decidieron unirse y formar este grupo con el cual esperan mejora sus negocios y su calidad de vida.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señorita Shirley, es soltera y vive con los padres, para ella este es su primer crédito y espera estar muchos años ya que con los créditos espera mejorar su actividad económica.
Doña Shirley con sus padres se dedican al comercio, ellos viajan a otras ciudades del Ecuador para vender sillas hechas en mimbre por artesanos de la localidad, venden en  Guayaquil, salinas y  varias ciudades de la sierra, cuando viajan se quedan dos o tres días en estas ciudades hasta que vendan todo lo que llevan, luego regresan y preparan el viaje para la próxima semana. Esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres la misma que ahora le sirve para salir adelante de una manera honrada
Este crédito es para comprar sillas de mimbre. Sus sueños son tener un carro para llevar sus productos ya que ellos viajan en trasporte público lo cual dificulta su labor.
texts.en:
The "Virgen De Guadalupe" communal bank meets every fortnight in Montecristi, a city known for it's rich pre-colonial culture. It's handicrafts are known nationally and internationally as it is the home of the famous Panama hat. This group is made up of 11 women and one man who on learning the benefits provided by the institution decided to get together and form a group, hoping to improve their businesses and their quality of living.

One of the group members is Shirley who is single and lives with her parents. It is her first loan and she hopes to stay with them for many more years hoping to improve her economic activity. Shirley along with her parents work in business, traveling to other cities in Ecuador to sell chairs made from wicker by artisans of the area. They sell in Guayaquil, Salinas and a number of cities in the mountains. When they travel they stay for 2 or 3 days until they have sold all that they have brought. Then they go home and prepare for their trip the next week.

She learned this business from her parents and now it's serves her as an honorable way to get ahead. This loan will be used to buy wicker chairs. Her dream is to have a vehicle to carry her products as she travels on public transportation which makes her work quite difficult.

loans.use: to buy wicker chairs.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a responsible woman. She is living in a rural area and was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is married and has two children. 

She does business in agriculture and her husband is also busy in it. Their business is a family business, and each member helps to work hard and gain income for living. For almost 20 years, Salima has been working in agriculture planting vegetables and grapes.

Salima is planning to buy fertilizers and seeds to have better land. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizers and seeds. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Maritza Jacqueline

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es operador de un montacargas y trabaja en Manta. 
Doña Maritza es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para poder solventar ciertos gastos referentes a los estudios de sus pequeños ya que con lo que gana su marido no alcanza y es gracias a su esfuerzo que pueden salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de bisuterías y joyas laminadas las mismas que vende puerta a puerta, también vende comidas rápidas  en sociedad con una tía, ellas en las tardes y noches venden hamburguesas, sanduches y hot dog. Es así y con la ayuda de los créditos se ganan la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar bisuterías, salchichas, frutas, gaseosas y otros víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos que venden. Lleva más de 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella mejora su calidad de vida. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
At the group site in the area called Montecristi, the Credit Group called La Pila meets every fifteen days. This place is well known in the province and country for its rich cultural tradition. Here, there can be found a large variety of artisan goods made by its residents following traditional customs.

Maritza lives in this place. She is 33 years old, married and from her marriage has two children, who are 7 and 5 years old and who are in school. Her husband is a forklift operator and works in Manta. 

Maritza is a woman who likes to work in order to be able to pay for the expenses relating to her young children's studies, since with what he makes her husband is not able to. It is thanks to her hard work that they have achieved success. She makes a living selling trinkets and costume jewelry, which she sells door-to-door. She also sells fast food, working with an aunt. In the afternoons and evenings they sell hamburgers, sandwiches and hot dogs. It is in this way and with the help of loans that she earns a living. 

This loan is to buy trinkets, sausages, fruits, soft drinks, and other provisions to prepare the foods they sell. She has worked with the Credit Group for more than 3 years and she likes it because thanks to these loans she has bettered her quality of life. Her dream is to provide the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy trinkets, sausages, fruits, soft drinks and other provisions

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
This is Bernadette, age 44, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nephtalie and has two children, one of which is in college and the other of which is in high school. She manages her household while operating the business, and she works hard to augment their income to cover their daily household needs and schooling.

Bernadette has a direct selling business. She sells skin and beauty products, footwear, undergarments, tupperwares other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Natasha, and Boardwalk. Dealers buy the products at a lower price than is shown in the catalog and sell them at a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1500 PHP in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, Bernadette is requesting a 51,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy merchandise items and orders of beauty products, footwear, toiletries and undergarments for her customers. Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given to her.   

Bernadette aims to grow her business so she can send her children to the best schools possible. She wants both of her children to finish college and see them become professionals soon.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for goods such footwear, undergarments, skin products like lotion, body powder, bath soaps, toiletries, tupperware, and other personal products to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline Beatriz

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Jacqueline, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y uno de 15 años, los dos menores estudian en universidad y colegio y son los que aun viven con ellos. Su esposo es maestro.
Doña Jaqueline es una mujer muy trabajadora que junto a su marido luchan día a día para darles lo mejor a sus hijos, ella tiene un taller en su casa en la cual se dedica a elaborar todo tipo de artesanías, elabora sus obras y luego las entrega a comerciantes de la zona o las vende al público en general pero esto en poca cantidad ya que no cuenta con un local,  ella lleva más de siete años con esta actividad la cual le ha permitido ganarse lo suyo que lo invierte en la educación de sus hijos
Este crédito es para comprar pinturas y materiales para fabricar las cerámicas. Este es su tercer ciclo y le gusta por la rapidez con que le dieron el crédito.  Sus metas son darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the area called Montecristi the Credit Group called La Pila meets every fifteen days. This place is well known in the province and the country for its rich traditional culture. Here there can be found a large variety of artisan goods that are made by its inhabitants following traditional customs. 

Jacqueline lives in this place. She is 48 years old, married and from this marriage has three children, two who are adults and one who is 15 years old. The two younger ones study in university and secondary school and still live with Jacqueline and her husband. Her husband is a teacher. 

Jacqueline is a very hard working woman that together with her husband struggles day in and day out to provide the best for her children. She has a workshop in her house where she works making all types of artisan goods. She makes her works and later gives them to vendors in the area or sells them to the general public but only in small quantities because she does not have a store. She has worked for more than seven years in this activity, and it has allowed her to make a living that she invests in her children's education.

This loan is to buy paints and other materials to make ceramics. This is her third loan cycle and she likes the group for the speed with which they provide loans. Her goal is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy paint and materials to make ceramics

loans.name: Sokleng

texts.en:
Sokleng, a farmer living in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, is 22 years old and she is the mother of a dependent kid.

She struggles for a living via growing rice as her main source of income. To supplement the family’s income, she raises two pigs. For Sokleng, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan to buy pesticides, fertilizers and seeds to support her farmland.

She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her current business and improve her family’s living to be better than before.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers and seeds to support her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ana Rose

texts.en:
Ana Rose is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana Rose is 40 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Ana Rose has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 35,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her business.

Ana Rose has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ana Rose would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her business

loans.name: Mayram

texts.en:
Mayram is an active woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1966. She is married and has three children. She has six years of experience and knows her business well.

She has a business of trading women's underwear in the central market. She has permanent clients and gets consistent orders from her customers. She travels to the capital city "Dushanbe” about ten times each month to buy goods. She is asking financial support from KIVA lenders and IMON to buy a new assortment of goods. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of goods.

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Unidos Venceremos, está formado por 10 señoras y 2 señores que tiempo atrás decidieron unirse y formar este grupo de crédito el cual les ha ayudado mucho para aumentar sus negocio y su calidad de vida. Ellos se reúnen cada 15 días en  Ciudadela del Maestro de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, lugar de gente honesta y trabajadora que hacen lo posible por darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Isela, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun  viven con ella, su esposo es empleado público. Ella es estilista hace varios años estudio en un academia en la ciudad.
Doña Isela  es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta a base de esfuerzo ir mejorando su calidad de vida y su negocio, ella tiene un spa  en el cual realiza diversos trabajos de belleza y arreglo personal como tinturados, depilaciones, tratamientos faciales, entre otros utilizando los más modernos aparatos, lo cual le ha dado muy buenos resultados ya que cada vez tienen más clientes. Ella estaba arrendando un local pero actualmente y con la ayuda de los créditos que ha recibido de la institución ha podido de a poco construir en su casa un local más amplio en el cual en los próximos días va a cambiarse y brindar un mejor servicio, trabaja todos los días y una de sus hijas le ayuda con sus labor ya que también es estilista, lleva más de 8 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le ha dado muy buenos beneficios y que cada vez mejora mas con la ayuda de los créditos, razón por lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito es para comprar cerámica, materiales de construcción que le faltan para terminar su local y también tintes para su trabajo. Es socia fundadora  del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos mejora su vida. Sus sueños son tener el mejor spa de la ciudad.
La foto pequeña es de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The credit group, Unidos Venceremos (United We Will Overcome), is made up of 10 women and two men that some time ago decided to unite and form the credit group – which has helped them improve their businesses and quality of life a lot.  

They meet every 15 days in Ciudadela del Maestro in the city of Portoviejo, a place with honest, hardworking people who do their best to give their families a better quality of life.  

One of members of this group is Mrs. Isela who is 46 years old, is married and from that relationship has four grown children. One of her children still lives with her, and her husband is a public employee. She is a stylist, having studied several years ago at an academy in the city. 

Mrs. Isela is a very hardworking women that likes – through hard work – to keep improving her quality of life and business. She has a spa where she performs various beauty and personal grooming services such as hair dying, waxing, facial treatments, among other services using the most modern equipment – which has given her very good results as each time she has more customers. 

She was renting a local shop, but currently with the help of the loans she has received from the institution – she has been able to little by little build a much larger shop in her house, which in the coming days she is going to change to and provide a better service. She works every day, and one of her daughters helps her with her work – who is also a stylist. She has made a living for more than eight years in this business, which has given her very good benefits and is ever improving with the help of the loans. For this reason, she is very grateful. 

This loan is to buy ceramic and building materials needed to complete her shop – and also dyes for her work. She is a founding member of the credit group and likes it because thanks to the loans she improves her life. Her dream is to have the best spa in the city. 

The small photo is of three members that could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy ceramic, building materials and dyes.

loans.name: Nelly Magaly

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional,  se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres  hijos de 12, 5 años y una bebé de 11 meses, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Nelly es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar  para sentirse independiente y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos que generan la crianza de sus hijos y el hogar, ella vende ropa de damas, caballeros y niños, ella sale casi todos los días en las mañanas a vender a las personas conocidas de la localidad  a quienes les da facilidades de pago,  lleva 7 años con su negocio  el mismo que  lo empezó con el primer  crédito que recibió del grupo y que ha podido ir mejorando con la ayuda de los créditos por lo cual está muy agradecida con la fundación y con las personas que hacen posible que reciba los créditos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos su vida ha mejorado. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The La Pila communal bank meets every 15 days in La Pila, in the Montecristi canton. This place is well known in the province and country for its rich traditional culture. A great variety of crafts can be found, made locally by the residents following traditional customs.

This is where Nelly lives. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children, ages 12, 5, and an 11-month-old baby girl. The two older children go to school. Her husband works as a driver.

Nelly has always enjoyed working in order to feel independent as well as to help her husband with the child-rearing and household expenses. She sells clothing: ladies's, men's and children's. She goes out almost every morning to sell to people she knows locally, to whom she extends credit. 

This is the same business she started seven years ago with her first loan through the communal bank. She has been able to expand it with subsequent loans, and she is very grateful to the foundation and the lenders who make this possible for her.

The loan will be used to buy clothing. Nelly is a founding member of the communal bank, and she enjoys it because her life has improved as a result. Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Miriam Alexandra

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
Aquí vive la señora Miriam, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 5  años el cual estudian en escuela. El marido chofer. 
Doña Miriam trabaja en una empresa nacional por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual, también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, cosméticos, perfumes y varios artículos más, ella vende en sus ratos libres y también a sus compañeras y clientes en su trabajo, ella les da facilidades de pago razón por la cual sus ventas siempre son muy buenas ya que les  deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Tiene más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo que les sirve para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, cosméticos y todo de lo que ella vende. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In Montecristi the Credit Group called La Pila meets every fifteen days. This place is well known in the province and the country for its rich traditional culture. Here, a large variety of handicrafts can be found. They are made by residents of Montecristi following traditional customs. 

Miriam lives here. She is 24 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has one child who is 5 years old and studying in school. Her husband is a driver.

Miriam works for a national company from which she receives a monthly salary. She also works in the sale of clothing of all types, cosmetics, perfumes and many other items. She sells these goods in her free moments and also to her co-workers and customers from her job. Her sales are so good because she provides help with payment by selling her goods on credit and collecting payment every 8 days. She has worked for more than 8 years in this activity, with which she has been able to make something to succeed.
