This loan is going to be used to buy clothing, perfumes, cosmetics and all other items that she sells. She has worked with the Credit Group for five loan cycles and likes it because the loans help her finance her business. Her dream is to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Florinda Ermencia

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Florinda, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y uno de 10 años, los dos menores estudian en colegio y escuela y son los que aun viven con ellos. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Florinda para ayudar con  los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella compra y vende  artesanías hechas en tagua y barro,  tiene un local en el cual vende sus productos,  compra las artesanías a artesanos del lugar pero sin pintar y luego ella con la ayuda de su marido y sus hijos les dan el terminado adecuado y pone sus artículos a la venta los mismos que son muy solicitados por sus clientes que a diario pasan por el lugar. Lleva más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo y contribuye al bienestar de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para vender al público. Lleva 5 años en el  Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos mejora su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the area called Montecristi the Credit Group La Pila meets every fifteen days. This place is well known in the province and the country for its rich traditional culture. Here, a large variety of artisan goods can be found. The goods are made by residents of Montecristi following traditional customs. 

Florinda lives in this place. She is 44 years old, married and from this marriage has four children, three of whom are adults and one who is 10 years old. The two younger ones are in school and still live with her. Her husband is a chauffeur. 

Florinda, in order to help with household expenses, works selling goods. She buys and sells artisan goods made of ivory palm and clay. She has a store in which she sells her products. She buys locally-made, unpainted handicrafts and later, with the help of her husband and children, properly decorates them and puts them up for sale. The handicrafts are requested by her customers, who pass her store daily. She has spent more than 10 years working in this activity, through which she has been able to make a living and contribute to  the wellbeing of her family. 

This loan is to buy handicrafts of all types and models to sell to the public. She has worked with the Credit Group for 5 years and likes it because with the loans, she has bettered her business. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy artisan goods

loans.name: Tania Rocio

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Tania, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 5 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Tania trabaja con su esposo, mientras el elabora artesanías en un  taller que tienen en su casa ella vende estas artesanías al público en un local que tienen en la vía principal lugar en el cual muchos comerciantes venden sus obras, el  fabrica  todo tipo de figuras las mismas que elabora  en barro o en cerámica semiterminadas,  ella en su local les da el terminado adecuado con pinturas de varios colores de acuerdo a la figura y luego vende a comerciantes de su localidad y también vende al público en general, llevan más de 10 años dedicados a esta actividad con la cual se ganan el sustento diario.
Este crédito es para comprar barro, pinturas y otras materiales para elaborar sus obras. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan en el grupo  para seguir adelante. Su sueño es mejorar día a día.
texts.en:
In Montecristi, the Credit Group called La Pila meets every fifteen days. This place is well known in the province and the country for its rich traditional culture. Here, a large variety of artisan goods can be found, which are made by the residents of Montecristi following traditional customs.

Tania lives in this place. She is 26 years old, married and from this marriage has two children who are 8 and 5 years old and are in school. Her husband is an artist.

Tania works with her husband, while he makes handicrafts in a workshop that they have in their home. She sells these handicrafts to the public in a store that they have on the main road, an area where many vendors sell their goods. Her husband makes all types of figures which are made with clay or semi-finished ceramic. In her store, she decorates the figures with different-colored paints in accordance with the figure and later sells them to vendors in her area. She also sells to the general public. She has spent more than 10 years working in this activity, with which she makes a living. 

This loan is to buy clay, paint and other materials to make her goods. She has worked with the Credit Group for three loan cycles and likes it because of the help it gives her to succeed. Her dream is to improve day by day.

loans.use: to buy clay, paint and other materials

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 45 years old and has six children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Belen is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Belen has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support her family and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beers, candies, detergent soap, sugar, coffee, etc. Carmen has been in this business for 5 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Carmen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, eggs, beers, candies, detergent, soap, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Analen

texts.en:
Analen is 36 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Analen is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Analen has been in pig fattening for 5 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Analen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: and her husband to repair his van so he can work.

loans.name: Jiguène Bakhna 18 Group

texts.fr: Jiguène Bakhna 18 est un sous groupe de l'Association des Femmes Commerçantes de Pout. Il est composé de 5 femmes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier et font la même activité. Elles sont toutes dans le marché et vendent des fruits et légumes. Elles font des tontines journalières et après le marché vers les coûts de 17h elles discutent de leur situation. Elles ont choisi Madame Khardiata comme présidente. Elle est reconnue sur la photo par la main levée. C'est une femme mariée et mère de famille. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des fruits et légumes pour renforcer son étale qui se trouve au marché. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 17h. Avec les revenus de cette activité, Khardiata supporte son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle souhaite avec l'aide de l'institution, augmenter ses revenus avec la diversification des ses produits.
texts.en: Jiguène Bakhna 18 is a subgroup of the Pout Association of Female Business Owners. It consists of five women who all live in the same neighborhood and engage in the same kind of business.  They all sell fruits and vegetables at the market.  They participate in a daily savings group and after the market around 5 pm, they discuss their situation.  They chose Madame Khardiata to be president. She has her hand raised in the photo.  She is married and mother of a family.  She is asking for this amount of money to buy fruits and vegetables to improve her selection of products at the market.  She has more than 10 years of experience.  She starts her day at 8 am and finishes at 5 pm.  With the income from this business, Khardiata helps her husband with their daily expenses and their children's school fees. With the help of the organization, she wishes to increase her income by diversifying her products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Kholbobo

texts.ru:
Холбобо 56 лет. Он житель района Хамадони. Холбобо женат и у него трое детей. Один сын и две дочери. Сыну 23 лет, а дочкам 32 и 26 лет. Старшая дочка замужем и мать двоих детей. У Холбобо еще есть племянники, которые живут вместе с Холбобо.  
Холбобо работает преподавателем в средней школе № 18, и свободное время он занимается  сельскохозяйственной деятельности.  Его жена в районе тоже занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Его сын учится в государственном университете города Куляб. Холбобо обратился за кредитом, чтобы оплатить за годовое обучение сына. Без оплаты будут исключать сына из университета.
texts.en:
Kholbobo is 56 years old, and a resident of the Hamadoni region. Kholbobo is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. His son is 23 years old, and his daughters are 32 and 26 years old. His older daughter is married and the mother of two children. Kholbobo also has nephews that live with him.

Kholbobo works as a teacher at High School № 18, and in his free time he does agricultural work. His wife also does agricultural work in their local region. His son studies at the state university in Kulob. Kholbobo has applied for a loan to pay his son's yearly tuition. Without the loan, they will have to take their son out of the university.

loans.use: to pay his son's tuition for the year.

loans.name: Monserrate Del Rocio

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Monserrate, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 13 y 7 años  de edad, los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Monserrate y su esposo tienen un taller de artesanía, allí ellos fabrican  todo tipo de figuras las mismas que elaboran  en barro o en cerámica, trabajan todos los días ya que la demanda de sus productos es muy grande, ellos entregan sus productos semiterminados  a comerciantes de su localidad y también venden al público en general, ellos también tiene un local donde ella la que se hace cargo de las ventas ya que su marido pasa más en el taller elaborando sus obras. Llevan más de 14 años dedicados a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar barro, pinturas y otros materiales que se requieren para elaborar sus obras. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan en el grupo. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The La Pila credit group meet every fortnight in the area of La Pila in the town of Montescristi. This area is very well known throughout the province and the country for its rich traditional culture. A variety of craftwork can be found here - created by the local inhabitants who continue to follow traditional methods and customs. 
  
Monserrate, 35, lives in La Pila, is married and has two children from the relationship who are 13 and 7 years old and studying at college and school respectively. Her husband is a craftsman.

Monserrate and her husband have a craftwork studio where they create many types of figures made from either clay or ceramic. They work every day because their products are in high demand and they deliver their semi-finished products to retailers in their area and also sell directly to the general public. They also have a local shop where Monserrate takes charge of sales while her husband spends more time in the studio crafting pieces. They have been making a living this way for more than 14 years.

This loan will be used to buy clay, paint and other materials needed to create their craftwork. They have had 3 loan cycles with the credit group and they are pleased with the help that they receive from the group. Their dream is to provide more for their children.

loans.use: to buy clay, paint and other materials.

loans.name: Jiguène Bakhna 75 Group

texts.fr: Jiguène Bakhna 75 est un sous groupe de l'Association des Femmes et Jeunes Commerçantes de Pout. Il est composé de 2 femmes et 3 hommes qui habitent tous dans le même quartier et pratiquent les mêmes activités. Ils se réunissent tous les fins de mois et organisent des tontines. Madame Tawra est la présidente, elle est reconnue par la main levée sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui a une expérience de 3 ans dans son activité. Elle évolue dans l'aviculture; elle demande ce crédit pour acheter des poussins et de l'aliment pour les élever, les engraissés et les revendre. Elle commence sa journée à 6h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle aide son mari sur la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l'avenir, elle souhaite avoir une ferme et un grand poulailler afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l'argent. Ainsi elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et s'épanouir.
texts.en: Jiguène Bakhna 75 is a subgroup of the Pout Association of Female and Young Business Owners. It consists of two women and three men who all live in the same neighborhood and engage in the same kind of business.  They get together at the end of every month and organize a savings group. Madame Tawra is the president. She has her hand raised in the photo.  She is married and mother of a family.  She has 3 years of experience in her business. She practices aviculture. She is asking for this loan to buy baby chicks and chicken feed to raise them and resell them.   She starts her day at 6 am and finishes at 7 pm.  She helps her husband with the management of their daily expenses and their children's school fees. In the future, she wishes to have a farm and a large chicken coop in order to increase her revenues and save money. Thus she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and flourish.

loans.use: to buy baby chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a married mother of 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 32 years old, and both of her children attend school.

Catalina has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more grocery items to sell to her customers.

Catalina has been in this business for 5 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Majidan

texts.en:
Majidan is a 46-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children.

Her husband owns a clothing business. His practice is to buy clothing from a wholesaler and sell it to the retailers. He has a lot of customers who like to buy clothing from him. Sometimes he purchases clothing from out of the city at a low cost and sells it to the retailers. He has a good reputation in the market and his current customers refer his clothing to the other retailers, which becomes good advertising. One of her sons also helps her husband in the clothing business, and both give part of their time to the shop. 

Majidan has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy more clothing of various colors and designs to fulfill the demand. She is in a repeated loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She has already been taking the loan from BRAC and investing in the business. Majidan hopes that the savings will be much increased so she can arrange the marriage ceremony for her daughter. 

Majidan dreams of the bright future of her children, the establishment of their business, and a better living standard for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase more variety of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools and chairs for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a married mother of 9 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old, and 5 of her children are in school.

Paulina has a buy-and-sell beverages business in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy beverages to sell.

Paulina has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 34 years old and has 3 children. She is married, and 2 of her children are currently in school.

Catherine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed, vaccines, and other supplies for her pigs.

Catherine has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and she has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Catherine would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Richan

texts.en:
Richan is 29 years old with 7 children. With 2 of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for all of them.

Richan runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as canned goods, condiments, and home care products, as well as other groceries.

Richan has been in this business for 3 years now, selling a variety of items like rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Richan would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, condiments, and home care products, as well as other groceries

loans.name: Jossie

texts.en:
Jossie is thankful that she was granted a 10000 PHP loan which she used to purchase supplies and merchandise for her direct-selling business. Her earnings support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

Jossie is now requesting another 10000 PHP loan to buy additional merchandise such as manicure sets, cologne, deodorant, footwear, fabric softener, undergarments and other products that are needed to increase her product inventory. Her sales income helps cover her family’s daily needs. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial assistance and a good return on her investment to fund their everyday needs.

Jossie dreams of having a store of her own to display her products and attract more customers. She prays for a brighter future and a quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise  to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 14 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Benkadi 14  vient de solder son 1er prêt avec kiva. Les remboursement ont été bien fait. Fati, responsable du groupe avait pu a acheter du céréale vendre et son bénéfice lui a permis de solder la scolarité de ses enfants et faire quelques dépenses. Fati et son groupe remercient tous les prêteurs de kiva. Elle voudrait un nouveau prêt pour continuer son activité. Après les ventes du céréale, Fati aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer à soutenir sa famille et faire son activité.
texts.en: Benkadi 14 just settled their first Kiva loan.  The repayment was in full.  Fati, the group representative, was able to buy cereal and resell it for a profit that enabled her to pay for her children's school fees and other expenses.  Fati and her group thank all of Kiva's lenders. She would like a new loan to continue her business. After the sale of cereal, Fati will have a profit that will allow her to continue to support her family and run her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals (corn, millet, beans) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the repair of her son's lathe machine and purchase new tools, dies, and spare parts.

loans.name: Cerenia

texts.en:
Cerenia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Cerenia has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Farolito Group

texts.es: Farolito es un grupo solidario integrado por cuatro mujeres emprendedoras que solicitan por tercer ciclo el financiamiento en ADIM para sus negocios, es coordinado por Eveling una joven que a sus 20 años de edad quien comercializa cosméticos AVON por más de un años, anteriormente cuidaba a una persona de la tercera edad y de los ingresos obtenidos impulsó su negocio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosméticos como es vanidades, pinturas labiales, pinturas de uñas, perfumes para damas, colonias, etc., los créditos anteriores le han ayudado a incrementar la clientela. El resto de las integrantes son las señoras, Magdalena de 37 años de edad y comercializa productos varios (jabón, pasta dental, detergente, etc.) de manera ambulante en los departamentos del país, María que tiene la edad de 40 años de edad y quien comercializa mariscos en la capital y departamentos del norte del país y cuenta con una experiencia de diez años en este negocio, y por último Ivania de 30 años de edad y comercializa marisco en diversos departamentos del país.
texts.en:
“Farolito” is the name of a solidarity group that consists of four enterprising women who are requesting their third loan from ADIM for their businesses. The group coordinator is Eveling, a young woman who is 20 years of age. She has been selling Avon cosmetics for more than a year. She previously took care of an elderly person and used her wages to start her business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cosmetics such as compacts, lipsticks, nail polish, women’s perfumes, colognes, and other products. Her previous loans have helped her to increase her clientele.

The other members are as follows:
• Magdalena is 37 years old and sells various products (soap, toothpaste, detergent, and other items) as a street vendor in various departments of the country.
• María is 40 years old and sells seafood in the capital, which is located in one of the northern departments of the country. She has 10 years of experience in this business.
• Ivania is 30 years old and sells seafood in different departments of the country.

loans.use: to buy compacts, lipsticks, nail polish, women’s perfumes, colognes, and other products.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 59 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Conchita has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Conchita has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Teresa to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as body lotion, shampoo, spices, biscuits, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs, milk, water and slippers. She has been involved in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Teresa independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, shampoo, spices, biscuits, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs, milk, water and slippers

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Corazon is 55 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Corazon has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Corazon has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk in bulk for her to both resell and make yogurt, butter, and cheese.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is grateful that he was previously granted a 50,000 PHP loan which he used to purchase feed and hogs for his piggery business. His business earnings helped cover his and his wife's everyday needs.

Vicente would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan so he can purchase additional hogs and feed for his piggery business. He thanks God and you in advance for both the financial help that will be given him and a good return on his investments. It will surely help cover their daily needs. 

Vicente prays to maintain and grow his backyard business. He aims to save enough for his and his wife's old age. He faithfully meets up weekly with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase feed and buy additional hogs for his business.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabian tiene 53 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa y sus 02 hijos en el distrito de Colasay que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La comunidad donde vive es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se conocen y se dedican a la agricultura y comercio principalmente.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros. Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientela fija que brinda muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esta inversión le permitirá ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Fabian is 53 years old and lives with his wife and their two children in their own house made of basic materials. He resides in the District of Colasay in Jaén Province, which is located in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The community where he lives is in a small rural area where the residents are known for engaging in agriculture and retail as their primary trades.

Fabian sells groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and other products. He has experience in this business and an established clientele who have provided good personal and work-related references on his behalf. His loan will be used to purchase a large quantity of products so that he can increase the inventory of his business. This investment will allow him to generate income to improve his financial situation and also his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of products so that he can increase the inventory of his business.

loans.name: Rosa Erminia

texts.es:
Rosa una mujer luchadora y perseverante, que a logrado grandes objetivos en la vida, ella cuenta que gracias al crédito anterior ella logro surtir mejor su tienda de abarrotería, con el que obtuvo buenas ganancias, ella ahora se encuentra muy estable porque gracias a las ganancias que obtuvo ahora ya cuenta con el negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano. Rosa ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo que lo invertirá en su nuevo negocio comprando sacos de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella guarda las esperanzas de conseguir  nuevamente el crédito, para que su vida y la de su familia siga cambiando.
texts.en:
Rosa is a determined and persevering woman who has established huge goals in life. She says that thanks to her previous loan, she was able to acquire more inventory for her grocery store and generate good earnings. That business is now extremely stable because of the profits she earned.

Rosa also has a business of selling secondhand clothes. She is requesting another loan so that she can invest in this new business. Rosa will buy sacks of secondhand clothes. She remains hopeful of securing this new loan since her life and that of her family are constantly changing.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Esmeralda is 48 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Esmeralda has a meat vending business in the Philippines. Esmeralda requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell in her meat stall.

Esmeralda has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Esmeralda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell in her meat stall

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Han is a 45-year-old married factory worker with five children. She has worked in the factory since 2011. Her husband is a 49 year old, and he is a construction worker. All of them live in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Three of her children are also factory workers and two attend school. Together, they can earn around $25 each day. She lacks the finances to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use, therefore she would like to request a loan. With the motorcycle from the loan, she and her family will be able to have better traveling conditions and reduce traveling expenses. For her future plans, Han is going to save money to buy more farmland, build a bathroom and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 73 años de edad, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad rural que se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica al comercio de ganado caprino y ovino, cuenta con 40 años dedicandose a este rubro por lo que tiene experiencia en este negocio y buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, esto le generará mayores ingresos y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 73 years old and resides in his own home in the District of Pomahuaca, a rural community that is known for agriculture and livestock breeding. This area is located in Jaén Province, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Pedro sells goats and sheep. He has worked in this trade for 40 years and has the necessary experience. Pedro has received good references from his neighbors. This loan will be used to buy a large quantity of livestock and balanced feed for fattening these animals. As a result, he will be able to generate more income and be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of livestock and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un (shown in the photo) is a 50-year-old widow who lives at Posen Chey District, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has three daughters. One is married and two are students. 

Nowadays, Un is a housewife, while one of her daughters is a student who studies at the university and works as teacher of English also .

Because she doesn't have a job, her daughters help a little with the family. She would like to apply for a loan to pay her daughter’s school fee.

loans.use: To pay her daughter’s school fees.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 55 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Flora works very hard to provide for her family.

Flora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more goods, like eggs, candies, biscuits, canned goods, coffee, detergent soap, etc., for resale.

Flora has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as eggs, candies, biscuits, canned goods, coffee and detergent soap. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Flora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods, like eggs, candies, biscuits, canned goods, coffee, detergent soap, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 61 years old and widowed with one child. Rizalina works very hard to provide for her family.

Rizalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items for resale, like canned goods, beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

Rizalina has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Rizalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items for resale, like canned goods, beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 49 years old and married with two children. With her two children in school, Rosana works very hard to provide for them.

Rosana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items for resale, like coffee, bread, personal care products and other groceries.

Rosana has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items for resale, like coffee, bread, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Dina Maria

texts.es:
Dina tiene 72 años es soltera vive en Guaranda, provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Mantilla.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y a la agricultura, solicita el credito para la compra de ganado y aumentar su negocio, las compras realiza en la plaza de animales de Guaranda, su sueño es viajar a Estados Unidos y en su tiempo libre le gusta leer.
texts.en:
Dina is 72 years old and lives in the community of Mantilla, which is in Guaranda in Bolivar Province. She buys and sells livestock and also raises crops. Dina is requesting a loan in order to buy livestock so that she can increase her business. Her purchases are conducted at an animal marketplace in Guaranda.

Her dream is to travel to the United States. Dina enjoys reading when she has free time.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea works hard to support her family. Irenea is married and has a candle making business in the Philippines.

Irenea requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials, such as wax, cords, etc., for her business.

Irenea has been in this business for 15 years now.

Irenea would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, such as wax and cords, for her business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is married with six children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda and deals in cocoa farming and selling to raise income to support his family. His clients are mainly cocoa companies in his area. He also sells vegetables to supplement his income from the cocoa business. Godfrey complains of inadequate capital to expand his business and seasonality changes. He hopes to improve his cocoa gardens and cocoa business in the future, build a permanent house and also educate his children.  He has asked for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy cocoa and vegetables like tomatoes and cabbages, and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and vegetables like tomatoes and cabbages, and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 34-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Kousar requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. 

Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years. He sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four-wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. 

Now he has opened a shop for selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy initial inventories to run his shop in a good manner. He wants to buy a rickshaw to carry more vegetables to more customers. He will buy a new rickshaw with the profit generated from his green grocery business.

His children are growing and their needs are increasing. To cope with the rapid increase in the school fees, books, utility bills, and household expenses, he wants to establish his business but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk.

Therefore, Kousar has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to help her husband to purchase fresh and seasonal vegetable to sell.

loans.name: Manogi

texts.en:
Manogi is a 55-year-old mother of seven children. She operates a business selling rice and fried chicken at schools, in her village, and at the market. 

Manogi needs to expand her business. In order to do this, she has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, sack of rice, tomato sauce, sack of flour, aluminum foil, frying pan, plastic bags and containers to help her in the business. Manogi became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, sack of rice, tomato sauce, sack of flour, aluminum foil, frying pan, plastic bags and containers.

loans.name: Synat

texts.en:
Yoeurn (pictured) is 31 years old and lives in Ang Snoul district, Kandal Province, Cambodia. He has been married since 2010, and he has one daughter. She is still young.

Yeourn is a construction worker with two years' experience, while his wife is a garment factory worker with three years' experience. Yeourn is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to his work. He said that with his own means of transportation, he can save money for everyday expenses. He wouldn't have to pay every day for transportation; he would pay just once.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is a taxi driver.  He has been in this business for ten years.  Rovshan is 35 years old. He is married and has three sons. 

One of these children is 11 years old, another 10 years old, and his little son is 7 years old . The elder son goes to class four, the middle son goes to class three, and the little son goes to class one.  They are IDP (internally displaced persons) from  Agdam city and now live in the Absheron region. 

Rovshan is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN to repair his car. This year his car was damaged and, therefore, he can’t work. Rovshan doesn’t work and can’t support his family. To restore their monthly income, his car needs to be repaired. 

He hope that if his car is repaired, his situation will be good enough, as before, to be able to support his family. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for help. In the future he wants to have a tidy house and to help his sons in education.

loans.use: to repair the car and increase business.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him (pictured here) is 31 years old, and lives in Ang Snoul district, Kandal province, Cambodia. 

He has been married since 2005, and has one son and one daughter who are still young.

Presently, Him is a construction worker with three years of experience, while his wife is a garment factory worker with nine years of experience. Him would like to apply for a loan to buy a cow to raise for supporting his family. He hopes that next year, he can get one more cow and then provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (pictured here) is 41 years old. A widow, she lives at Donkor district, Kandal province district, Cambodia. She has five sons and one daughter. Four are garment factory workers, one is a hairdresser, and the last one is attending school.

Srey has three years of experience as a garment factory worker. She would like to apply for a loan to buy hair-cutting materials for her son. She said that the increased income can support the family better. She will pay back the loan to Maxima on time.

Note: (The man who stands with her is her son.)

loans.use: to buy hair-cutting materials for her son.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.pt:
Tem 41 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 4 filhos 1 maior de idade já no seu lar, os 3 ainda a estudarem, cuida  de um neto menor, tem 6ª classe e vive à base de negocio de venda de alguns produtos de lanche para crianças e roupa usada, negocio com o qual  sustenta a sua família e os estudos dos seus filhos. Está a repetir o credito pela 3ªvez e sempre investiu no mesmo negocio.
Pretende comprar: fardos de roupa usada, bolachas, rebuçados, sumos, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio.
Seu sonho é ter uma casa em boas condições para habitar e construir um estabelecimento para vender os seus produtos em sua casa.
Diz ter dificuldades de modo geral na vida, mas tenta superar com ajuda do esposo serralheiro.
texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old and is married with four children, three of whom are in school and one of whom is grown and living independently. She also cares for a grandson.

Victoria studied through 6th grade and makes a living selling lunch items for children and second-hand clothing. This business allows her to support her family and pay for her children's education. This is her 3rd loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner], and she also used the money from previous loans for her business.

With this loan she will buy packs of second-hand clothing and cookies, candy and juices, etc. to expand her sales business.

Her projects and dreams for the future are to have a house in good condition and to build a space there to sell her products from her home. She says that her life has not been easy but that she tries to move ahead with the help of her husband, who is a locksmith.

loans.use: buy packs of second-hand clothing as well as cookies, candy and juices, etc. to expand her sales business.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng (shown in photo) is 35 years old and lives at Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 2004. She has one son and two daughters. They are still young.

Sokheng has sold fruits and vegetables for ten years, while her husband is a fisherman and construction worker with ten years of experience. Now she is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to take vegetables and fruits to sell. She wants to get more money so she can support her family better than before.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to take the vegetable and fruits to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lilibeth is 35 years old and her two children are in school.

Lilibeth has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia works hard to support her family. Cresencia is married and has a selling soft drinks business in the Philippines.

Cresencia requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell.

Cresencia has been in this business for 20 years now.

Cresencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Debra

texts.en:
Debra is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Debra is 43 years old and has four children who are in school.

Debra has a general store business in the Philippines. Debra requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Debra has been in this business for two years. In the future, Debra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 64 years old and married with nine children. Adelina works very hard to provide for them.

Adelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items for resale, sell like canned goods, bread and other groceries.

Adelina has been in this business for 35 years now. 

In the future, Adelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items for resale, sell like canned goods, bread and other groceries.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 50 years old and has eight children. Rita is married and has six children who are in school.

Rita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rita requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rita has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Merza

texts.en:
Merza is 46 years old and married with two children.

Merza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Merza has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Merza aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 40 years old and married with four children.  With two children in school, Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elma has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Elma would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and her four children are in school.

Cecilia is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a 3,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Cecilia has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed loans three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 55 years old and has two children. Merlita is married woman.

Merlita is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Merlita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Merlita has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta works hard to support her family. Roberta is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Roberta requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Roberta has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Roberta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a personal products direct sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more personal products to sell in her personal products direct sales business.

Lourdes has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from selling frozen food.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more personal products for resale.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Imelda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy raw products and other ingredients needed for her food vending business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw products and other ingredients needed for her business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 46 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Violeta has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, candies, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Violeta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn is 50 years old and widowed. Geralyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Geralyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries.

Geralyn has been in this business for 20 years now. 

In the future, Geralyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph  is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He lives at his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. His potential customers are neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Joseph dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that he is requesting of KES 20,000, he wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with six children, five of whom attend school, while the other is still too young for schooling. John owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

John has operated a business as a carpenter for the past 20 years, selling his products to the community. He mentioned seasonality and theft as major challenges in his place of operation.

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase more materials, like timber and nails, to use for his business. He decided to join Yehu to gain access to the loan and boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials, like timber and nails.

loans.name: Mdoe

texts.en:
Mdoe is a married man with four children, three of whom attend school. The other one is still too young for schooling. He owns a house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 10 years, he has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of business. 

With the KES 15,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Horm's Group

texts.en:
Horm is 39 years old and is a married mother of four children who are all dependent children that she needs to take care of. Three of her children are in school while another one is too young to get in school. She is resident in a rural area located in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. 

The main source of her family’s income has been rice farming for fifteen years and to earn more income, she is also feeding pigs and fishing as well. She could earn around 53,000 KHR per day and save around 27,000 KHR daily for when needed. 

Horm’s group consists of four members. She has taken a loan from VisionFund for eight cycles already and completely paid back the loans. The previous loans helped her to have enough food and consumables to use. 

Now she is leading the group to apply for this loan and will use her portion to buy fishing supplies to support her current business. She hopes that she could earn more income to expand her business and have enough ability to send and keep sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
Sun is 61 years old. She is a married woman who has seven children, and four of them are dependents. Only two are in school. 

Sun is originally from a rural area in Stoeng Sen district of Kampong Thom province. The main source of her family's income has been from rice farming for 20 years. To be a better support for her family, she also works for other farms to earn more income. 

Sun’s group consists of four members, and this is the second loan for her with VisionFund Cambodia. The previous loan helped her to have better living conditions. Now, she is leading the group to apply for this loan, with her portion to be used to install a private toilet for her family. She hopes that her family will live with sanitation and health.

loans.use: to install a private toilet.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Jelia

texts.en:
A $800.00 loan is offered to Jelia to improve her business. Jelia opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own work. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like body lotion, biscuits, noodles, fish, slippers, and sugar. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Jelia is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, biscuits, noodles, fish, slippers, and sugar

loans.name: Phoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Phoeurn is 45 years old and a married mother of five children; one of them is a dependent child and in school. She lives in a rural area located in Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. The sources of her family income are from rice farming, fishing and working for another farm for twenty five years. She can earn around 86,000 KHR per day for her family’s needs. 

Phoeurn’s group consists of two members. She has borrowed loans from VisionFund for four cycles already and completely paid back the loans. The previous loan could help her to have better living conditions and enough food to eat. Now she is leading the group to apply for a loan, with the portion to buy fishing supplies to support her current business. She hopes that she can earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Nheak's Group

texts.en:
Nheak is originally lives in a rural area located in Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is 49 years old, and a married mother of seven children; two of them are dependent children who are still in school. The main source of her family income is from rice farming for twelve years. To better support her family and to earn more income, she also does fishing and feeding pigs. She can earn around 64,000 KHR per day and save around 40,000 KHR daily for when it's needed. 

Nheak’s group consists of four members. She has borrowed loans from VisionFund for four cycles already and completely paid back the loans. The previous loan could help her to have better living conditions and enough food to eat. Now she is leading the group to apply for a loan, with the portion to buy fishing supplies to support her current business. She hopes that she can earn more income and expend her current business.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed runs a small grocery store in one of Taiz's areas, in Yemen. He has had that business selling canned food, soft drinks, shampoo, phone cards recharge, and other items, for more than eight years. 

Despite his long experience in this field, his income is still very small and he works hard to improve it, but he doesn't have enough money to do. 

As a result, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials and other goods to expand his business. This loan will increase Mohammed's profits and he will be able to cover the necessary expenses of his five children in addition to providing them with better living conditions. 

The diversity of purchasing the goods by this loan will help Mohammed to attract a lot of customers which will help his business to flourish.

Mohammed looks forward to opening a store to sell gas cylinders for further expansion.

loans.use: To purchase food materials and other goods to expand his business.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 33-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her whole family is fully dependent upon her brother, who has only a single source of income. In fact, she is living along with her brother's home and is fully dependent upon him.

Her brother owns a workshop in which he provides the services to paint and assembled the bodies of auto rickshaws. He removes the dents over the rickshaw’s body and paint for renewal. Mostly he paints the whole body of the rickshaw for renewal. His stock of paints has been used up and he does not have enough cash in hand to buy paint for services, because he has already spent his savings upon the maintenance of his workshop. Therefore, Uzma requested a loan for her brother so that he would be able to buy new cans of paint.

loans.use: to help her brother to purchase new stock of cans of paint.

loans.name: Asymas

texts.en:
Asymas (shown in the photo) is 39 years old and lives in Muk Kompul district, Kandal province, Cambodia.

She has been married since 1992. She has four sons and three daughters. Three are studying, two are helping her to sell roast chicken, and the other is still young.

Asymas sells roast chicken with one year of experience, while her husband has done the same work for one year, too.

Asymas is now applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her sons to take to school every day. Nowadays, her sons go to school by taking a tuk tuk (a rickshaw). She wants her sons' transportation to be easier than before.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her sons to take to school.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is 36 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Samoa.
Sara owns and operates a small vegetable garden (fruits) business in her village. She has been running her business for a year, and hopes to expand. In order to do this, Sara needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, water tank, vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), raincoats, rake, and knife to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, water tank, vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), raincoats, rake, knife

loans.name: Paineta

texts.pt:
A senhora Paineta tem 40 anos de idade, é divorciada, mãe de 4 filhos, todos menores de idade, 3  frequentando o ensino primário e 1 ainda sem idade escolar,vive na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar bolachas, refrescos e pão para reforçar o seu negócio.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são ter uma casa melhorada e adiquirir uma viatura para o uso pessoal.
Diz que tem como desafio a insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz um xitique mensal como forma de poupar e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Paineta is 40 years old and is divorced. She has 4 children, three of whom are in elementary school and one of whom is not yet of school age. She lives in her own home.

Paineta tells us she will use this loan to buy cookies, refreshments and bread to strengthen her business. Her projects and dreams for the future are to have a better house and to buy a vehicle for her own personal use.

She says her main challenge is a lack of funds. To overcome this she participates in a traditional Mozambican system of communal savings called xitique and she also plans to take out more loans to help make her plans a reality.

loans.use: buy cookies, refreshments and bread

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 41 years old and married with two children. With her two children in school, Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items for resale, like rice, junk food, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

Lorna has been in this business for four years now. 

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items for resale, like rice, junk food, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is a hardworking female entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items, like canned goods and personal care products, to sell at her store.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, such as a clothing retail business. 

Melly dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home

loans.use: to buy items, like canned goods and personal care products, to sell at her store.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marlyn requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Marlyn has been in this business for 15 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Arlene is borrowing 15,000 through NWTF to buy more merchandise for resale, like curtains, towels, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money in order to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for resale, like curtains, towels, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 26 years old with three children. With two children in school, Madelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Madelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items for resale, like canned goods, cigarettes, home care products and other groceries.

Madelyn has been in this business for six years now. 

In the future, Madelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items for resale, like canned goods, cigarettes, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Mary Ann requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients and materials, like bamboo sticks, seasonings, spices, meat, etc., for her business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for six years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mary Ann would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and materials, like bamboo sticks, seasonings, spices, meat, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresita is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Teresita has a selling accessories business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Teresita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is 37 years old and married with five children. Two of her children are in school.

Martina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Martina requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Martina has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Martina would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rowena is 39 years old and has five children who are in school.

Rowena has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old, a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Teresita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and to pay for the repair of her fishing boat.

Teresita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and pay for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a 45-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Vivian has a vegetable and dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Vivian requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables and additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Vivian has been in this business for five years. In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old and married, and she has five children, four of whom are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 35 years old, married with three children, and currently employed by local government as an office typist. 

Her desire to earn a living has kept her in this job for five years now, and she hopes to build a residential house for the family, despite facing a challenge of low salary pay to meet her desire. 

Irine has requested a loan to buy iron sheets for roofing her family house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing her family's house.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita works hard to support herself. Angelita is single and has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines.

Angelita requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to resell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Angelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Anastacia has been in this business for six years. Anastacia earns more income from food vending.

Anastacia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a thirty-four-year old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a hotel as his main source of income which business he started with an intention of generating funds and meeting family demands. He also practices produce growing and selling of maize to earn extra income. 

He hopes to own a well known hotel in the future; however he faces a main challenge of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands and competition.

Tadeo needs a loan to buy more chairs, tables, bags of rice, beans and other items for his hotel.

loans.use: to buy more chairs, tables, bags of rice, beans, and other items for his hotel.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 53 years old with four children, all of whom are in school.

Her husband is a farmer. They earn their livelihood through planting fruits and vegetables and selling them in their community. Her husband takes care of planting and delivering their product in their community while she sells fruits in her fruit stand. These help in school expenses and their daily needs.

Their opportunity came when they asked to sell and deliver products to a hotel. She was also allowed to put a stall near the hotel area to sell her fruits. Since their farm products are only pineapples and banana, she started to buy other fruits from their neighboring farm to sell in the hotel so that they gain an income of PhP 5,000 daily.

From the recommendation of their customers, now other hotels are also asking to deliver and sell their products to them. They wanted to expand her business to gain more income and took the new opportunity to deliver and sell fruits to other hotels so that they could afford to put their children in good colleges.

Yolanda is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to buy five boxes of apples, five boxes of oranges,  five boxes of grapes, five boxes of pears, ten boxes of pears, and other assorted fruits to sell in her fruit store. 

Yolanda wanted to expand her business more and wanted to export their local products someday.

loans.use: To buy five boxes of apples, five boxes of oranges,  five boxes of grapes, five boxes of pears, ten boxes of pears, and other assorted fruits as additional fruits to sell in her fruit store.

loans.name: Kimsroy's Group

texts.en:
Kimsroy is a 30-year-old married mother with one dependent kid living in the Kroch Chhma district of Kampong Cham province. 

For a living, she and her husband grow cashew as the main source of income. Sometimes she works for others for a fee in order to supplement income. She has been involved in her job for 12 years and it earns her family about 25,900 KHR per day. 

This is her fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loans. In a group of four members, she is the group leader. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for workers working on her farmland. She hopes that she can expand her current business to earn more income to improve her living.

loans.use: to pay for workers working on her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province; Kroch Chhma district

loans.name: Aurora

texts.pt: A Senhora Aurora vive numa casa propria com o marido, dois filhos e dois sobrinhos,  É formada em contabilidade, é gestora de um centro infantil e dona de outro entro infantil, que emprega cerca de 3 educadoras, uma copeira e um guarda. Conta neste momento com cerca de 45 crianças. Com o presente  empréstimo vai adiquirir biliches(camas) para crianças. Tem sonho de ter uma infra-estrutura própria de raiz, uma vez que agora trabalha numa infra-estrutura arrendada no bairro de Patrice Lumumba-Matola. Uma das suas metas é de tornar o centro infantil numa escola que lecione todo o ensino primário completo. Tem como maior desafio a aquisição do espaço e a contrução da escolinha.
texts.en:
Aurora lives in her own home with her husband, two children, and two nephews. She has a degree in accounting, manages a child care center, and owns a second child care center that typically employs 3 teachers, a housekeeper and a guard. Right now there are about 45 children who attend the center.

With this loan Aurora will buy beds for the children in her center. In the future, she would like to build her own infrastructure from the ground up for the center, as right now the center is housed in a rented space in the Patrice Lumumba neighborhood of the city of Matola. One of her goals is to turn the child care center into a school that offers a full elementary school curriculum. Her greatest challenge is finding a space in which she could build this school.

loans.use: buy children's beds.

loans.name: Erika Maria

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer de 31 años de edad, que desde tempranas horas de madrugada se levanta a hacer las labores del hogar, preparar el alimento y atender a su hijo de 12 años, le sirve el alimento y lo lleva a estudiar, después de hacer este “ritual”, comienza con sus labores ella trabaja en una confección a terceros, tiene su taller ubicado en su hogar, este trabajo y forma de vida significa esperanza y oportunidad de progreso para Erika., ya que desde que inicio con este en el año 2013 ha visto como su calidad de vida comienza a mejorar y proyecta su vida hacia un mejor futuro económico.

Su sueño y propósito que se trazó al iniciar su negocio fue mejorar sus condiciones de vivienda y poder sostener a su hijo, sus gastos y su hogar.

Erika quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual desea invertir en la compra de una maquina recubridora e hilos, dicha maquina será un gran aporte en los tiempos de confección y acabados de las prendas.
texts.en:
