Доходы от кредита позволят Кенжебубу улучшить благосостояние семьи и в дальнейшем развивать ее бизнес.
texts.en: Kenzhebubu is 53 years old, married, and a mother of two. Kenzhebubu has a vocational education, and has spent almost her whole life getting a basic income from livestock and agriculture. At present, Kenzhebubu has six cows, forty-five sheep, and has a plot of land measuring 2.80 hectares where she grows potatoes and alfalfa. Her children help around the farm. Kenzhebubu applied to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd. Income from the loan will allow Kenzhebubu to improve the prosperity of her family and further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Jose Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, debido a la guerra que hubo en el país no pudo seguir estudiando, está acompañado y su pareja le ayuda en la agricultura, tienen dos hijos y todavía no asisten a la escuela.

Samuel, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, pues fue con su papá que aprendió este oficio, además le gusta la crianza de ganado; la necesidad y el no tener otra oportunidad lo llevo a  dedicarse a la agricultura; ahora siembra maíz, pipián y plátano, no tiene otras actividades económicas.- Sus cultivos están a 8 cuadras desde su casa, labora en su cultivo desde las 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. solo descansa a la hora de almorzar, su esposa le ayuda a cortar pipianes.

El crédito será invertido para comprar una vaca, para conseguir ingresos adicionales para su familia.

Sus sueños son, que sus hijos estudien y se preparen académicamente, construir su casa de ladrillo y llegar a tener diez vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
Samuel, 33, attended school until third grade. Due to the war in his country he was unable to continue working.  He is married and his wife helps him with his farming.  Together they have two children who are still too young for school.  Samuel has worked in agriculture since he was 12 years old, having learned from his father.  He also likes raising livestock.  His need and the fact that he did not have any other opportunities led him to work in farming. He now grows corn, squash and plantains. He has no other jobs. His crops are 8 blocks from his house and he works there from 6am to 4pm, only resting at lunchtime.  His wife helps him to cut the squash.

The loan will be used to purchase a cow that can be used to earn additional income for his family.  His dreams are from his children to attend school and prepare themselves academically, to build a brick house and to someday have 10 dairy cows.

loans.use: purchase a cow.

loans.name: Chim's Group

texts.en:
Chim is a resident in a rural area located in Bovel district of Battambang province. She is age 30, and she is a married mother of three children who are all dependent. One of them is in school, while the other two are too young to get in school. 

The sources of her family’s income are from potato farming, rice farming and working for other farmers for ten years. She could earn around 116,000KHR per day and save around 40,000KHR each day for when needed.

This is the first loan for Chim’s Group, which consists of two members with VisionFund.  

She decides to borrow this loan with a portion to pay for labor and to hire a tractor to plow her farmland. 

She hopes that she could earn more income and have the ability to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to pay for labor and hire a tractor to plow her farmland

loans.name: Mgumba

texts.en:
Mgumba is a married woman; she has five children, all of whom attend school. Mgumba owns a house that neither has electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mgumba operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 35,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Amistad Group

texts.es: Aldo de 25 años de edad es soltero. El forma parte del grupo “Prosperidad y Amistad” y está formado por 05 socios solidarios y responsables. Aldo trabaja como conductor de carro. Su mayor deseo es de tener su propio negocio y así poder ayudar a sus padres. Solicitó el crédito para arreglar el carro con el cual trabaja. El grupo “Prosperidad y Amistad” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de crecer en sus negocios. Aldo se encuentra sentado es el primero del lado derecho y visto polo color marrón oscuro.
texts.en: Aldo is 25 years old and single. He is part of the group Prosperidad y Amistad (Prosperity and Friendship), which is comprised of 5 united and responsible members. Aldo works as a driver. His greatest desire is to have his own business and so to be able to help his parents. He is requesting a loan to repair the car that he drives for work. The group Properdad y Amistad is grateful to the Kiva lenders for giving them the opportunity to grow their businesses. In the photo, Aldo is sitting, the first person on the right, and wearing a dark brown t-shirt.

loans.use: to fix the car that he uses for work.

loans.name: Tuloto

texts.en: Tuloto is a 54 years old with 5 children. She runs a small business of selling vegetables in her village and at the market. She has been doing this for more than a year to earn a living. Tuloto needs a loan of $1500.00 WST, to buy chemicals, vegetables seeds(eggplant, cabbage), wheelbarrow, rake, water tank, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit for home improvement and provide for her children's needs. Tuloto joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a chemicals, vegetables seeds(eggplant, cabbage), wheelbarrow, rake, water tank,

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 46-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and five children. One of her children is working and the others are still attending school. Due to the bad financial conditions, she cooperates with her husband, who is their main income provider, to improve their lifestyle. 

Khadija opened a clothing shop in 2000, where she offers a great variety of clothes for women and children at good prices. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new collection of clothes so that she can improve her business operations and follow up on the new fashion. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and therefore her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Davina

texts.en:
Divina is thankful that she was granted an 8,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed to grow her farm. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for another Php 8,000 loan which she will use to buy more fertilizer and farm inputs for a more productive pineapple harvest. Her earnings from her farm will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and for her children’s education. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Divina dreams for her farm to always have a bountiful harvest. She aims to give children a college education to uplift their lives. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lindsay

texts.es: Doña Lindsay tiene un pequeño mini super donde vende productos de consumo diario. El negocio tiene mas de 10 años, sin embargo ya necesita de un arreglo debido a que el tiempo ha provocado problemas con el negocio. además de esto necesita comprar mas productos para surtir el negocio. Ella espera conseguir con el préstamo un mejor servicio y así mayores ventas que le permitan mejorar el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Lindsay has a small grocery store where she sells products for daily use.  Her business is over 10 years old and in need of repairs because time has created problems for her business.  She also needs to purchase more products to stock her business.  She hopes that with this loan she will be able to provide better service and increase her sales so that she can improve her family's wellbeing.

loans.use: stock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Munay Warmis Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUTIMUY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonia ella es viuda y tiene 43 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de confeccion de modas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "KUTIMUY" communal bankThis bank is located in Cusco district, in the province of Cusco, in the state of Cusco.  

Antonia, one of the members, is a 43 year old widow with three children. She works in her grocery store where she sells basic goods such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies.  She works from 8am to 7pm.  Her business is 5 years old and it has gone very well for her.  Antonia's dream is to expand her business. She is seeking this loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

The other members work making clothing, selling clothing, running grocery stores and running bookstores.  They are grateful for those who are taking part in making their dreams come true through this loan.  They are committed to repaying the loan on time.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly, 38, is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nelly has a firewood retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF, to buy more firewood for sale.

Nelly has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Nelly would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for sale

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana, 48 years old, is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Emiliana has a general store business in the Philippines. Emiliana requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF, to buy more inventory, items like sardines, noodles, soap and other groceries.

Emiliana has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Emiliana would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like sardines, noodles, soap and other groceries for her store.

loans.name: Maria Corazon

texts.en:
Maria Corazon is 39 years old and married with eight children, six of whom are in school. Maria Corazon works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF, to buy items like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, egg, etc. for sale.  Maria Corazon has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Maria Corazon would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, egg, etc for sale.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fishing. 

Glenda requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, coffee, etc.

She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, 46, has a live-in partner and seven children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elena has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years. 

Elena requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a 53-year-old married woman with nine children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Luz has a business buying and selling bamboo in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years.

Luz requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of bamboo to sell.

In the future, Luz would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 49 years old and married with one child.  

Elvira is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Elvira has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Elvira requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elvira would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is forty eight years, married and lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. He trades in cattle mainly buying and selling meat and earns additional income from cocoa gardens. He started the business in 1990 with his first loan of three million. he is proud of the progress although challenged by increasing transport costs and limited capital. He hopes to expand his cattle business in future. Charles has requested a loan of four million to buy more cattle for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for sale.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Ma. Cristina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

In the future, Ma. Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Valetino

texts.en:
Valetino is married with six children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, and has dealt in cocoa farming and selling to raise income for family support since 200. He sells to cocoa companies. His main challenge is limited capital. 

He hopes to improve his cocoa gardens and cocoa business in the future, and also to educate his children using the proceeds.  

He has asked for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders, meet Elizabeth from Litein, Kenya, a woman from a community not known for farming, but she is earning a living through agriculture. She is happily married, and together with her husband is blessed with a lovely family. 

For the past 20 years, she has been practicing mixed farming, and, because of the experience she has, she commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers and is regarded as a mentor. Income from selling milk, eggs, and maize has allowed her to earn a decent living. 

Elizabeth passionately loves dairy farming, and animals on her farm have been given names. Milking and feeding her cow makes her very proud. By selling milk, she has had good returns, and the demand for milk has been expanding. 

Through extensive use of her mobile phone, she receives orders from customers and then sends her customers a text message when the milk is ready for collection. Demand has been overwhelming, and she needs an extra cow to satisfy fully the demand. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Elizabeth does not intend to buy just an ordinary cow; she wants to buy a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce rich, creamy milk. The dairy cow will produce between 10-15 liters of milk a day. The increased milk production will translate into more income, and Elizabeth will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children going to school.

Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Jacqueline Lisseth

texts.es:
Jacqueline, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a enderezar y pintar automóviles, tiene una hija de 10 años de edad, que va a cuarto grado. 

Jacqueline, se dedica al cuidado del hogar, también sale a planchar a casas ajenas, para lograr obtener un ingreso para el hogar, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m. y sale a las 3:00 p.m. a seguir trabajando en su hogar, cuidar a su hija y preparar la cena para su pareja.

El préstamo será utilizado para colocar una pequeña tienda en su casa, ella comprará, café, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, leche en polvo, dulces y detergentes.- Ella quiere colocar la tienda, porque en donde vive no hay ninguna cerca y tiene oportunidad de generar buenos ingresos para su hogar y poder ayudarle a su pareja con los gastos.  

El sueño de Jacqueline, es que su hija tenga todo lo necesario y ayudarle para que se gradué de la universidad.
texts.en:
27 year old Jacqueline studied until the 9th grade. She has a partner who paints cars and does panel work. She has a 10 year old daughter who is in the 4th grade. 
Jacqueline looks after the house and also goes to people's homes to iron so that she can make income for the household. She works from 8:00 to 3:00pm then does the housework, cares for her daughter, and cooks dinner for her partner. 
She will use the loan to open a small store in her house. She will buy coffee, sugar, rice, beans, powdered milk, sweets, and detergents. She wants to open the store because there isn't one near to where she lives and she has the opportunity to make a good income for her household and to help her partner with the expenses. 
Jacqueline's dream is that her daughter will have all that she needs and to help her so that she can graduate from the university.

loans.use: to open a small store in her home. She will buy coffee, sugar, rice, beans, powdered milk, candy, and detergents.

loans.name: Kanyshai

texts.ru: Канышай, 32 года, замужем, есть трое детей. У Канышай седнее образование, она занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее есть 2 коровы, лошадь, также на 1,20 ГА собственной земельной доли, Канышай выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход Канышай составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). Канышай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и топлива для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистой фасоли. Доходы от ведения бизнеса Канышай планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Kanyshai is 32 years old, and married with three children. Kanyshai has a secondary education, and she works in agriculture. She has two cows, a horse, and has her own share of land measuring 1.20 hectares, where she grows haricot beans. Kanyshai's monthly income is around 12,000 som (KGS). Kanyshai applied to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizers and fuel for land cultivation and growing organic haricot. With income from the business, Kanyshai plans to invest in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fuel for land cultivation and growing organic haricot.

loans.name: Leccidy Mara

texts.es:
Mara es una chica joven, vive junto a su madre en  la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los  Colorados, ciudad caracterizada por ser el puente terrestre que une a las regiones del país. 
Mara es una joven muy alegre, carismática y trabajadora, siempre ha querido superarse por su propio esfuerzo; por ello hace más de un año decidió emprender en el negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, comenta que le ha ido muy bien, ella visita a clientela fija que gracias a ellos ha podido seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
Mara además de estos ingresos ella trabaja como profesora de tenis de mesa, comenta que trabajar con jóvenes le ha ayudado a ser más carismática y dejar a un lado la timidez. Con el crédito ella podrá comprar más ropa como pantalones, blusas y ternos de niños, desea aprovechar ya que viajará donde venden más barato y comprará al por mayor para poder mejorar las ganancias. Con los ingresos de su negocio tiene planificado estudiar como abogada en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Agradece a Kiva y a la Fundación por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Mara is a young woman who lives with her mother in the city of Domingo de los Colorados. The city is known for being a land bridge which unites the regions of the country. Mara is very cheerful, charismatic and hard-working. She has always wanted to achieve success through her own efforts. More than a year ago, she decided to start a business selling clothes and shoes. She says that it is going well. She visits her regular customers. Thanks to these customers, she has been able to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur. 
In addition to these earnings, she works as a table tennis instructor. She says that working with young people has helped her to become more charismatic and to put aside her shyness. With the loan, she will purchase more clothing like pants, shirts, and children's suits. She wants to take advantage of this opportunity because she will be traveling to an area where she can buy wholesale items for less in order to make more profits. With the earnings of the business, she plans to study law at the city's university. Thank you to Kiva and to the Fundacion Alternativa for their support.

loans.use: purchase more clothing like pants, shirts and children's suits.

loans.name: Francisco Tomas

texts.es:
Francisco  vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, una ciudad conocida en el país por ser una zona productiva y comercial, con un clima cálido húmedo agradable. Ahí cuenta con una humilde casa que a ha podido construir poco a poco gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo durante años.
Francisco tiene tres hijitos, ellos actualmente viven con su madre, siempre está pendiente del bienestar y la educación de sus pequeños. Francisco de lunes a viernes trabaja como maestro constructor en obras del municipio de la ciudad, ya en las tardes él se dedica a su negocio, tiene chanchos los cuales los cría y cada fin de semana los faena  y vende la carne a los vecinos del sector. Gracias a este ingreso él ha podido superarse y sacar adelante a su familia
Francisco con este crédito el podrá comprar más chanchos y balanceado para su alimentación, en un futuro quiere contar ya con una granja de crianza de cerdos, pero para ello necesita ir creciendo poco a poco.
Agradece a la institución por el crédito otorgado
texts.en:
Francisco lives in Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a city known in the country to be productive and commercial. It has a warm, humid climate that is pleasant. 

He lives in a modest home that he has been able to build little by little thanks to his work efforts throughout the years. He has three small children who currently live with their mother, and he is always monitoring the well-being and education of his little ones.

He works from Mondays to Fridays as a master builder for projects of the municipality, and later during the day, he works at his own business: raising pigs. Every weekend, he slaughters the pigs and sells the meat to the neighbors. With this income, he has been able to improve himself and get his family ahead.

This loan will allow Francisco to buy more pigs as well as balanced feed to raise them. He is looking to set up a pig farm, but for that he needs to expand this work gradually. He is grateful to the institution for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and balanced feed to raise them. In the future, he would like to own a pig farm.

loans.name: Zura

texts.en:
Zura is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Zura owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Zura has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Sakorn's Group

texts.en:
Sakorn, a villager living in Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, is 62 years old. She is a widow with four children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in high school. 

She struggles for a living via selling fish and raising pigs. She has been involved in this business for 25 years. 

This is her eighth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loans. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fish to sell. She hopes that she can earn more income to support her child to study until graduating.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
"Joyce, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 48 years old, married and has 6 children.

Joyce likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and has decided to represent her group, because she wanted to be more active in her community. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant, that she has learnt a lot from the farming training. Joyce plans to use the profits from this coming season, to send her children to school.

In total, Joyce’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizer to improve harvests of maize and solar lights.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia es una mujer que ha sacado a su familia adelante, ella tiene un negocio de venta de comidas. Actualmente tiene dañada la freidora la cual utilizar para realizar la mayoria de sus productos, por lo que necesita un préstamo de cuatrocientos mil colones para comprar una nueva y así seguir vendiendo su comida. Ella desea ir invirtiendo poco a poco en su negocio para mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos
texts.en: Nidia is a woman who has successfully raised her family. She has a small business selling food. The deep-frier that that she uses to make the majority of her products is currently damaged. So, she needs a loan of $775 to buy a new one so that she can keep selling her food. She wants to invest in her business little by little to improve her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy a frier for her food business.

loans.name: Tahmaz

texts.en:
Tahmaz is 30 years old. He has been married for 9 years. His family is from Fuzuli city and now lives in Absheron region.  It has been 22 years since Tahmaz’s family are IDP (internally displaced people) from their native land Fuzuli.  Tahmaz’s wife Nigar. is a hair dresser.  He has a daughter who is 7 years old and is in first grade.
Tahmaz is a taxi driver. He wants to repair his car and buy new wheels. He applied for a loan with Komak organization for 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Tahmaz is thankful to Komak and Kiva for the loan. In the future, he wants to install an air conditioner in his car.

loans.use: to buy new wheels for his car.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  

Nelita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Nelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rickshaw transport business in the Philippines. Elena has been in this business for five years now.

Elena requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg lives in the frontier village Yenokavan of Tavush region. He has a big family and correspondingly, a lot of expenses each month. Each member of the family greatly helps Gevorg in farming and agriculture, since it is the only source of income for their entire family. In his farm Gevorg has cows, a calf, a heifer, a bull, horses, pigs and sheep. Gevorg sells beef, pork and mutton from his farm, which it is rather profitable, and also sells milk and cheese, which his wife manages. Their children are very active helpers in land cultivation activities, especially during harvesting period. On his plot of land he cultivates potato, greens, carrot and beans, also fruit trees such as apricot, apple, fig and nuts. 
With this loan, Gevorg plans to repair his cattle barn.  He will also buy animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to repair his cattle barn and he will also buy animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Leak's Group

texts.en: A resident living in Srey Snom district of Siem Ream province, Leak is 38 years old. She has two dependent children studying in high school. She grows rice as the main source of income. She also raises a pig to supplement her family’s income. She has been involved in this work for 20 years, and it earns her about 19,400 KHR per day. For Leak, this is her fifth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of four members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy fertilizers and to plow the farmland to grow cassava.  She hopes that she can earn more income to update her family’s living, and to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plow the farmland to grow cassava

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 6 years. Estrella earns more income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Estrella has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es una ama de casa de 58 años, su esposo Lucio de 64 años se dedica a la agricultura. Juntos han logrado sobrevivir con su familia de 8 hijos enfrentando las más duras situaciones. En la actualidad viven con dos de sus hijos que ya pudieron estudiar. Doña Paula hace las tareas de la casa y algunas veces cocina pan para vender y Don Lucio se encarga de las fincas de café orgánico.
Actualmente Paula solicita un crédito para su meliponario orgánico de abejas meliponas (sin aguijón). Ella tiene varias colmenas de meliponas en su casa y desea colocarlas en cajas tecnificadas ya que las cajas que posee están mal construidas (contaminan la miel al momento de la extracción y las abejas corren más peligro de ser atacadas por otros insectos). La miel orgánica de las abejas meliponas es un producto muy escaso en los mercados nacionales e internacionales así que los precios son buenos y las ganancias aportan buenos ingresos a las familias productoras.
La producción de miel de meliponas permite a doña Paula tener acceso a un alimento sano así como vender el excedente para poder comprar algunas cosas de uso básico para las cuales los ingresos de la familia muchas veces no alcanzan. El préstamo ayudara a Paula a tener producción de calidad que podrá vender en su cooperativa COCAFCAL de la que es socia. Además la cooperativa le brindará el servicio de asistencia técnica.
texts.en:
Paula is a 58 year old housewife. Her husband, Lucio, is 64 years old and is a farmer. Together with their family of 8 children, they have survived when confronted with the toughest situations. They currently live with 2 of their children who have already finished studying. Paula does the housework and sometimes makes bread to sell and Lucio is in charge of the organic coffee plantation. 
Paula is currently requesting a loan for her organic apiary of stingless honey bees. She has some honey bee hives at her home and wants to replace them with modern hives as the one's that she has are badly constructed - the honey gets  contaminated when it's extracted and the bees are in danger of being attacked by other insects. 
Organic honey from these bees is a rare product in the markets in the country and internationally, so the prices are good and the profits give the producers good income. 
Making honey gives Paula access to a healthy foodstuff and a commodity to sell so that she can buy some basic items that the household income sometimes can't cover. The loan will help Paula to have high quality production so that she can sell through the COCAFCAL cooperative, of which she is a member. The cooperative also offers technical assistance.

loans.use: To buy 8 boxes of bees (Trigona angustifera) and a beehive for her organic honey apiary.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her bag-making business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan, which she will use to buy more fabric, canvas, thread and other materials needed to make different kinds of bags for sale. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her and a good return on her investment, for it will surely cover their daily sustenance.

Sonia hopes to buys a vehicle to easily transport her bags to different stores. She dreams to have a better life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials such as canvas, fabric, zippers, buttons and garters to make different kinds of school bags.

loans.name: Toi

texts.en:
Toi is a 48-year-old mother with four children. For more than a year, she has operated a business selling taro and bananas at the market to earn a living and provide for her family’s needs. Toi hopes to expand her business and export her produce overseas. She joined SPBD in 2013.  

Toi is requesting a 1,500 WST loan to buy taro root seedlings, banana root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, safety boots, chemicals, and a back-bag sprayer to help her run her business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and supplies for her business

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta is 59 years old and is a widowed woman with five children who are in school. For the past seven years, she has run a rickshaw transport business in the Philippines. Fausta is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Fausta is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan from NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools to maintain her rickshaw. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools to maintain her rickshaw

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Perpetua works hard to support her family. She works selling rice in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Perpetua has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF.

Perpetua is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jacinta is 45 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Jacinta has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Jacinta requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her fish stall.

Jacinta has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Jacinta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Emerlinda

texts.en:
Emerlinda is 52 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Emerlinda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

Emerlinda has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Emerlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for 26 years. Jennifer earns additional income from egg vending.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. Julieta is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Julieta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Julieta has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Julieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Urunsa

texts.ru: Урунса, 63 года, вдова, есть сын. У Урунсы- среднее образование, она пенсионерка и дополнительно 20 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Урунса очень любит свою деятельность, на земельной доле 1,0 ГА она выращивает кукурузу. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец и коз. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. Накопления Урунса старается вкладывать в образование и воспитание детей и внуков, а также в развитие бизнеса. Урунса обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку 5 овец. Благодаря кредиту, Урунса сможет откладывать доходы от бизнеса на дальнейшее его развитие, что позволит улучшить материальное положение семьи.
texts.en: Urunsa is 63 years old, and is a widow with one son. Urunsa has a secondary education, she is a pensioner and, additionally, has worked for 20 years in crop cultivation and animal husbandry. Urunsa loves her work very much, and grows maize on her plot of land of 1.0 hectares. There are also two cows and ten sheep and goats on the farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS), but this isn't enough for a decent life. Urunsa tries to invest her savings in the education and upbringing of her children and grandchildren, and also in the development of the business. Urunsa applied to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy five sheep. Thanks to the loan, Urunsa will be able to put aside income from the business in order to develop it further, which will help to improve the family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy 5 sheep in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent with one child, Lourdes works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.

Lourdes is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Keov ’S Group Leader

texts.en:
Keov was selected to be the group leader for a four-member loan request from Maxima. Members are all from a village in Meanchey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Keov, the second from the right in this photo, is 54 years old and has been married since 1980 and has five sons and one daughter. For 20 years, Keov has been a retailer and her husband has been a farmer. She will use her 300 USD part of the group loan to buy goods to sell. Keov wants to increase her family’s income. 

Sam is 29 years old and has been married since 2008 and has one son and one daughter who are still young. Sam works in a garment factory and her husband is a motor taxi driver. She will use her 300 USD part of the group loan to purchase a motorcycle take to her work. 

Savy is 31 years old and has been married since 2002 and has two sons, one of whom is attending school. For the past year, Savy has been a garment factory worker and her husband is a motor taxi driver with five years experience. She will use her 300 USD part of the group loan to purchase a motorcycle take to her work. 

Chacriya is 30 years old and has been married since 2013 and has one son who is still young. For the past six months, Chacrirya has sold food and her husband has worked as a garment factory work for the past five years. Chacrirya will use her 300 USD part of the group loan to buy goods to sell in her stall.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Señor De Muruhuay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Nohemy Yolanda ella es casada y tiene 65 años. La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas. 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de pan, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group are members of the SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY community bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

Nohemy Yolanda is a member. She is married and is 65 years old. She has a business raising and selling animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens, helping them grow and fattening them, and sells them in different fairs. She is an entrepreneurial woman who wants to get her family ahead with this business. She provides for her children with this small business. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the guinea pigs and chickens.

She requests the loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens and food for the guinea pigs and chickens. The other members of the group make a living from the sale of bread, the sale of animals, a general store business and a restaurant business.

She thanks those who form part of this dream through this means [Kiva] and promises to pay her dues in the agreed upon time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens and food for the guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es: Pamela es una joven emprendedora. Ella tiene un puesto de venta de refrescos y le ha ido bien, sin embargo la demanda es mayor de lo que esperaba y el negocio no cuenta con la capacidad. es por esto que ella necesita comprar mas mercadería para poder cumplir con la demanda de los clientes. Esto le permitirá mejorar su negocio ya que es la única entrada de dinero con la que cuenta su familia.
texts.en:
Pamela is a young entrepreneur.  She has a place where she sells refreshments, and it has been going well for her.  Nevertheless, the demand is bigger than she expected, and the business is not able to meet the demand.  

That is why she needs to buy more merchandise in order to be able to meet the customers’ demand.  This will allow her to improve her business.  This is the only source of money that the family has.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en:
Mariane is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her only child to school and meet their daily living expenses. Aside from her general store she is also a tricycle operator.

She would now like to apply for an 11,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, instant noodles, and clothes which she sells at retail. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her tricycle. Her income from her store and tricycle is a stable source to meet her family's basic needs and for her child's education. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Mariane dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her child the best education until college to allow her a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, beverages, clothes,  and for tricycle maintenance as well.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, a married woman, works hard to support her family in the Philippines.

For six years, she has had a rope-making business and is in need of more raw materials. Lilia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials and save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her rope-making business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hard-working married woman in the Philippines. She has operated a restaurant business for ten years and works diligently to support her family.

To increase her profits, Lolita has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Ma. Pene

texts.en:
Ma. Pene is 51 years old, married, and a mother of one child who still in school. Ma. Pene works very hard to provide for them.

For seven years, Ma. Pene has operated a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, candies, cereals, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Ma. Pene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Belen

texts.en:
Ma. Belen is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Belen is 44 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Ma. Belen has a rickshaw transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

Ma. Belen has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa works hard to support her family and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for six years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save more money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Menda

texts.en:
Menda is 38 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school, Menda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

Menda has been in this business for three years.

In the future Menda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish, plastic bags, blocks of ice, etc. for her fish vending business.

Grace has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish, plastic bags, blocks of ice, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more energy-saving cookstoves to sell to her community.

loans.name: Maebel

texts.en:
Maebel is 57 years old and a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maebel has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Maebel requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like pants, curtains, towels and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Maebel has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Maebel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, curtains, towels and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 46 years old and is a married woman with three children. Two of her children are in school, and she is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marietta has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marietta has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Marietta would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Dorina works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load). Dorina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of charcoal to resell.

Dorina has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Chance Group

texts.en:
Riziki is from Uvira. Five women are part of the Wezesha Project, with the group name of Chance, in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

Riziki is married and a mother of seven children. She is 38 years old. The group members are focused to transform their lives through small loans, as well as their standard of living to create a more prosperous future for themselves. 

Riziki is asking for a loan of $150 to purchase more cassava. This is her third loan from the Wezesha Project, and she is thankful for the confidence, and of course, for the support.

In the photo, Riziki is the first on the right.

Riziki continues to work hard so that she can maintain and improve her business. She hopes that this will help her to increase her capital. The profit after selling will be used to pay her children's school fees. Her biggest dream for the future is to live a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase cassava

loans.name: Neriza

texts.en:
Neriza is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, her children were able to graduate from college and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan, which she will use as her part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods that she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store helps cover her daily personal and household needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Neriza dreams of having a bigger general store and a more comfortable, prosperous life in their senior years. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bigger quantity of clothes.

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
Redentor is thankful that he accessed a 19,000 PHP loan which he used for maintenance and for renewal of his tricycle permit. His earnings helped cover their personal and household expenditures. 

He would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan which he will use to pay for the registration and maintenance of his tricycle unit. It is important that his tricycle is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. He is thanking God for the safe trips of his service and the financial help for it will surely help fund his basic daily needs.

Redentor plans to buy more tricycle units. He dreams to lead a more prosperous life and save for his old age. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the registration and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a business of direct selling personal products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of products to sell.

Vilma has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling of personal products business for nine years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of products to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business. 

She is borrowing 15.000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF supports  her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Arlet Maite

texts.es:
Arlet es una chica de 20 años, vive junto a su madre  en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa. Arlet cuenta con un pequeño negocio, desde que salió del colegio ella se dedica a vender ropa y variedades, es conocida en el sector, comenzó recorriendo de casa en casa, ahora actualmente ya pudo adquirir una vitrina para aprovechar un local que hay en su casa. Arlet ya se ha establecido pero aun así ella sigue recorriendo y visitando a su clientela. Comenta que es el primer crédito que pudo obtener ya que en otras instituciones por la edad no el han podido ayudar; con este crédito ella podrá comprar más pantalones, blusas, sandalias y ropa interior ya que está próxima la temporada estudiantil y es donde aumentan sus ventas.
Se siente feliz porque gracias al crédito podrá seguir creciendo como microempresaria y en un futuro desea estudiar la universidad con sus ingresos propios.
texts.en:
Arlet, age 20, lives with her mother in the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas in the coastal region.  It has a pleasant climate.  It is a very commercial city, and it is considered to be the place that joins the mountains and the coast.

Arlet has a small business.  She has been selling clothes and other products ever since she left school.  She is well-known in the area.  She started by going from house to house.  She was able to get a display case and take advantage of a place in her house now.  Arlet’s business has been established, but she still continues going out and visiting her clientele.

She says that this is the first loan she was able to get.  Because of her age, other institutions have not been able to help.  With this loan she will be able to buy more pants, blouses, sandals, and underwear.  The school season is coming, and that is when her sales increase.

She is happy because, thanks to the loan, she will be able to continue growing as a small businesswoman.  In the future she wishes to use her own earnings to study at the university.

loans.use: to buy more pants, blouses, sandals, and underwear.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 60-year-old married woman with four children, one attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Teresita has had a business selling herbal medicine for 10 yeaers. Teresita requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF  to buy additional stock of herbal medicine to sell.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of herbal medicine.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a mother from Litein, a remote town in Kenya. She has spent the past seven years farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet.

Emily is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close with her animals that she has nicknamed them .Emily wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. 

She would like to expand her poultry business, but does not have the capital. She requests 40,000 KES to buy  poultry.  Emily will use the loan to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and enable her to save money.

Emily is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Emily dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée âgée de 31 ans. Mère de deux enfants,  Yawa vit à Adidogomé pour entreprendre ses activités. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Yawa vend des pagnes dans le quartier en se promenant afin d’avoir un revenu. Yawa s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Dans le souci d’avoir un nouveau stock, Yawa sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des pièces de pagnes qu’elle pourra vendre et faire une bonne rentabilité afin de soutenir son mari à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en:
Yawa is a married woman aged 31. Mother of two children, Yawa lives in Adidogomé to undertake her activities. In order to meet the needs of her family, Yawa sells pagnes (lengths of African print cloth) in the neighborhood while walking around, in order to earn income. She stocks up three times a month in the market. 

Wishing to have new merchandise, Yawa is asking for this loan to buy lengths of pagne that she will be able to sell to make a good return so that she can help her husband with the daily needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy five lengths of pagne (brightly colored African print cloth)

loans.name: Eli

texts.fr: Agée de 47 ans, Eli est une femme mariée qui habite à Adidogomé. Pour exercer une activité, Eli vend des charbons de bois et trouve son gain favorable. Eli s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois, Eli nécessite ce prêt pour financer sa commande et réaliser plus de gains pour l’épanouissement de son foyer.
texts.en:
Aged 47, Eli is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé. In order to run a business, Eli sells charcoal and makes a good profit. She stocks up three times a month in the market. 

In order to buy some sacks of charcoal, Eli needs this loan to cover her order and make a higher profit so that her household can thrive.

loans.use: to buy 27 sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Nji

texts.en:
This borrower is married with four children, living in a two-room house in the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced many challenges in life, among which are the death of his wife, father, and mother.

He holds a positive view of succeeding in a soldering activity and wants to buy a soldering machine, rent a workshop, and also install an electric meter, because the majority of people use iron doors and windows. 

With the profit from this Empowerment Credit (loan) he will improve the family's living conditions, pay his children’s fees, and extend his farmland. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of its lower interest rate; the loan is repaid in installments, and the long duration is unstressful and also coupled with non-financial services offered by GHAPE such as training in time management, generating income without incurring expenses, treating of 12 decisions, and social networking.

loans.use: To buy a soldering machine, rent a workshop, and also install an electric meter.

loans.name: Narjes

texts.en:
Narjes is a 29-year-old, married, Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and two children. Although her husband, a soldier, is the main income provider in the family, she decided to support her husband by working days and nights to meet their expenses and maintain her business operations.

Since 2013, she has owned a mini market. Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase food provisions and new shelves for her business. In this way, she will be able to increase her revenues and improve her family's way of living. She looks forward to expanding her work.

loans.use: to purchase food provisions and new shelves for her mini market.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various fruits and veggies to sell at her fruit stand. By God's grace and blessings she was able to send her son to College and he has recently graduated from a flying school.

She would now like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities and varieties of fruits and veggies such as "lanzones", oranges, mangoes, cabbage, sweet potatoes, carrots etc.to sell at her fruit stand. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Yolanda dreams of having a Fruit/Veg. stand and a more prosperous life in her senior years. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for  mangoes, oranges, lanzones, grapes, cabbage, sweet potatoes, carrots, etc. to sell at her fruit/veg. stand.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 30 years old, married, with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jonalyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Armie

texts.en:
Armie is 35 years old and married with three children. Armie works very hard to provide for them.

Armie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Armie has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, noodles and other groceries.

In the future Armie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wencie

texts.en:
Wencie is a 40-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Wencie has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Wencie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of clothing to offer for sale.

Wencie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Wencie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of clothing to offer for sale.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 44 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. Ruby works very hard to provide for them.

Ruby runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Ruby has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Ruby would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Vivian, an ever-smiling young farmer who is responsible and has had to overcome many difficulties through her life. However, she has always found the strength to move forward and to keep growing in her life. 

Vivian has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. She is the proud owner of a small parcel of land, on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. Her primary sources of income are selling eggs and milk, and through this venture she has earned a decent income. She also engages in personal business in order to make ends meet. 

Vivian passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cows. Although this humble mum has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. 

Vivian is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. With the loan capital, she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help to fully satisfy the demand. Through Juhudi Kilimo,  a Kiva field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money in order to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée et mère d’un seul enfant, Adjo est âgée de 37 ans et vit à Adidogomé. Dans son atelier, Adjo vend des produits cosmétiques et des mèches pour répondre aux besoins de son ménage. Adjo s’approvisionne une fois par semaine au marché. Pour commander des mèches, des tissages et des défrisants,Adjo demande ce crédit pour réaliser son objectif afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour aider son enfant dans son éducation
texts.en:
A married woman and the mother of an only child, Adjo is 37 and lives in Adidogomé. In her salon, Adjo sells cosmetic products and weaves to meet household expenses. She stocks up once a week in the market. 

So as to order some hair extensions, weaves, and straighteners, Adjo is requesting this loan to attain her goal and have the necessary profit to help her child with her education.

loans.use: to buy 20 hair extensions, 10 weaves, and 20 straighteners

loans.name: Hean's Group

texts.en:
Hean is a 35-year-old married mother of two children who are both dependent on her. She lives in a rural area located in Sambour district, Kratie province.  Potato farming has been the only source of her family’s income for several years. With this current business, she could earn 80,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first micro loan for Hean’s group of two with KIVA’s partner, VisionFund. Now Hean is leading her group to apply for a first loan, She will use her portion to buy seeds for her farmland. She hopes to have enough food to eat, clothes to wear, and to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds for farming

loans.name: Joeseph Ngang

texts.en:
Joseph is married and has seven children. They are living in a five room house at Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon. He hates thinking about how his pigs were stolen and also the death of his parents. He is very confident that his farming activities will be successful because he has grasped the perfect knowledge about his poultry techniques, and for the past few years, his farming has been profitable.

 The loan from GHAPE will be used to purchase chicks, piglets, feed, and to rebuild a pig’s sty. The community will benefit by being able to buy manure to improve fertilization, and he will offer temporal employment to the neighbors and sell chicken at relatively moderate prices. 

With the profit from the farming, he will be able to expand his farm, educate his children in school, look after his health, and also cater to the needs of the family. 

He prefers a loan from GHAPE because it has low interest rates, and a new loan can be given as soon as you finish the old one, coupled with the fact that GHAPE offers non-financial services including trainings, social networking, and mainly because they do not ask for collateral before loan disbursement.

loans.use: to buy chicks, piglets, feed, and to rebuild a pig’s sty.

loans.name: Jescar's Group

texts.en:
Jescar is 46 years old and has 7 children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Jescar is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 8 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Jescar started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Jescar’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 48 years old and has 9 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Sarah has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Sarah also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Sarah's Group will be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata is a farmer in a village in Gori region. With passion he grows different field crops and fruits. Recently, he has started to build up a hazelnut field. The soil in this region is very eutrophic, so that the hazelnut trees do not need any chemical fertilizers and produce ecologically sound nuts of excellent quality. The Georgian market for hazelnuts is very good, the producers have no problems selling. 

The shortage of water is an important concern for the regional agriculture. The wells must reach deeper and deeper for the groundwater. So Paata decided to install an efficient drip irrigation system on his farm. It takes only as much water to the plants as they need, nothing is wasted. The loan allows Paata to buy and install the necessary water tanks and tubes.

loans.use: to install a drip irrigation system on his farm in order to water the plants efficienty.

loans.name: Ruzudan

texts.en: Ruzudan lives in a village in meager Gori region. She has four children and seven grandchildren who live in the city. On her small farm she keeps chickens, pigs and cows and cultivates a vegetable and fruit garden. She uses the produce to make a living and to supply her family members with healthy food. The hard-working woman wants to improve several parts of her farm, e. g. the water supply and the barn. The loan will help Ruzudan to realize those provisions.

loans.use: to improve the water supply, the barn and other parts of the farm which supplies her and her big family with food.

loans.name: Victorine

texts.en:
Victorine is married with five children.  They are living in a three room house at Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon. She has faced some problems in her life.  These have hindered her a lot and range from the death of her parents, a ghastly motor accident, and inadequate finance to provide standard education and medication to her family. 

The new loan she requested will be use to buys items like Irish potatoes, beans, yellow yams, rice, corn, coco yam, rent a piece of land, buy yams seedlings, fertilizers, chicks and traditional regalia material. She is so optimistic that she will succeed. She has run the business for quite some time and has got lots of experience and technique. This is coupled with the fact that her business site is located in a strategic position and has the availability of ready customers. The community will benefit from this activity as people will have ready food items at cheaper prices and available at all times.

The profit from this loan will be used to increase the size of the business, raise the family's standard of well being, pay school fees and also construct a family house. 

She prefers a loan from GHAPE because it has low interest rates at convenient repayment terms.  It also offers non financial services like training to manage business capital successfully and profit and loss account details. She also benefits from the ideas exchanged through their  bi-monthly and monthly meetings and social networking.  She is constantly followed up with for proper utilization.
