loans.use: To purchase items like Irish potatoes, beans, yellow yams, rice, corn, coco yams, yams seedlings, fertilizers and chicks.

loans.name: Lineth

texts.en:
Ten years ago Lineth started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kipsuter, a remote village in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Lineth believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Lineth waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is 53 years old married man, from the village of Poladauri. He has a 5-member-family, and they earn a living with agricultural activities. Islam and his family members work hard to have financial stability and good living conditions. They are engaged in cattle and cow breeding, in cultivating family-owned agricultural land, where potatoes and tomatoes are grown. Islam's wife sells milk-products and harvested vegetables from the house. They have loyal customers among local people, as they always have high quality products. 

Islam has great desire to expand the area of trading and purchase a mini-bus. The start-up program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,000 $ to purchase a mini-bus. Islam will sell the harvested vegetables through other districts and will get more profit. 

He is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person with a great desire to ensure his family have good living conditions. This credit will be a great support for the family. Islam is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus and expand his trading.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Alicia  se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz y papa, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alicia belongs to the comunal bank "Reyna de Los Angeles de Urquillos."  This bank is located in the Huayllabamba region of Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

Alicia is a farmer who cultivates corn and potatoes.  She works from 8am until 6pm.  She has been doing this work for a number of years, and it is going very well.  Alicia dreams of expanding her farm.  She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

Alicia is pleased to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Elicenda

texts.es:
Maria tiene 58 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge en casa propia en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y se respira armonia y felicidad ya que es una comunidad rural y pequeña donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y comercio, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, cerdos, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender con mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old.  She lives with her husband in her own home in the Zaña district, a community where life is tranquil and people live in harmony and happiness.  This is a small rural community where the residents work in farming and commerce.  It is located in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.

Maria works raising and selling animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs.  She has more than 5 years of experience with this business, which is located on her property.  Maria is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of animals, and to buy nutritionally balanced feed to fatten them.  With this investment she will be able to have more animals to sell to her customers, and this will allow her to increase her income and thereby improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals and to buy animal feed

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Emily is 36 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Emily has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Emily also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Emily's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mable's Group

texts.en:
Mable is a 47-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Mable has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Mable described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Mable’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat  is 53 years old, a married woman and a mother of 4 children. In order to support her family she began the business of milk selling with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales so she can generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Brigid's Group

texts.en:
Brigid is 29 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Brigid is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Brigid's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to repair her home.

Brigid and her group will receive a total of 10 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 8 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 43 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Rose likes to think of herself as a very friendly person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Rose plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Rose’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 3.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Kiwafu Muslim School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Baker. He is the Head Teacher of Kiwafu Muslim School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Entebbe in Wakiso with 700 students. Kiwafu Muslim School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. 

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kiwafu Muslim School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Baker ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for the students.

loans.name: Sacred Heart Boys School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Odomaro. He is the Deputy Head teacher of Sacred Heart Boys School, a boys school in the Rural area of Sheema in Mbarara with 500 students. Sacred Heart Boys School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. 

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Sacred Heart Boys School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Odomaro ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for the students.

loans.name: Che Beltha

texts.en:
She is married with five children and she lives in a two-room house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced a lot of problems in her life including accidents, sickness, death, and theft.

She is very optimistic about her farming activities. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds such as maize, beans, yams and hire laborers to work her farm, and repair her house. She thinks she will be successful because she has been practicing it for a long time and so her customers know her and always demand her product.

With profit made from this loan she intends to change the roof of her house, also pay her children’s fees and also to expand her farming. She will help the community, provide manure for farming, provide ready market for her farm products and offer transport services. 

She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of lower interest rates and the interval of repayment is really encouraging and so unstressful.

loans.use: To buy seeds such as maize, beans yams, hire laborers to work her farm, and repair her house.

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es:
Héctor, de 52 años de edad, solo estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado y su esposa tiene una pequeña granja de pollos, tienen tres hijos y todos están estudiando.

Héctor, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene diez años de edad, con su papá aprendió el oficio, también le gusta la crianza de ganado, decidió dedicarse a este tipo de trabajo, pues no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar.- Específicamente,  siembra maíz y maicillo, su terreno está ubicado a dos kilómetros desde su casa y para llegar lo hace a pie, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 del mediodía.

El crédito sera utilizado para comprar una vaca.

Su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos graduarse de una carrera universitaria y llegar a tener 10 vacas.
texts.en: Héctor is 52 years old. He only attended up to third grade of school. He is married and his wife has a small chicken farm. They have three children who go to school. Hector works in agriculture since he was ten years old. He learned this job with his father. He also likes to raise cattle. He decided to work in this because he did not have the chance to study. Specifically he grows corn and sorghum. His land is located two kilometers from his house and he walks to get there. His schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 noon. He will use the loan to buy a cow. His greatest dream is to see his children graduate from college and to be able to have 10 cows.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, de 67 años de edad, no estudio porque para sus padres no era necesario estudiar, está acompañado y tiene 3 hijos, todo están casados, solo vive con su pareja.

Francisco, se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde desde hace 5 años, también se dedica a la agricultura y tiene terneras; hizo su pequeña galera y empezó con poquito ganado.- Se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para poder limpiar la galera y ponerle comida a las terneras.  

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar más pollos y concentrado para engordarlos, el crédito le ayudará a mejorar el negocio y obtener un poco más de ganancias. 

El sueño de Francisco es hacer una galera más grande y poder tener más pollos para comercializarlos.
texts.en: Francisco is 67 years old. He didn't study because his parents didn't think it was necessary. He is married and has 3 children. They are all married, he lives alone with his spouse. Francisco has worked raising broiler chickens for 5 years. He also farms and has calves. He made a shed and began with a few calves. He gets up at 5 in the morning to be able to clean the shed and feed the calves. The loan will be used to buy more chickens and concentrated feed to fatten them. The loan will help him improve his business and make a little more profit. Francisco's dream is to make a larger shed and be able to have more chickens to sell.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and concentrated feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is a 25-year-old woman from the city of Kutaisi, west Georgia. She lives with her parents and brother. The family members are temporarily unemployed and Teona is the only breadwinner. She works as a salesperson, earning approximately 300 GEL. As the income in insignificant to meet all of the family's daily costs, Teona decided to also be involved in another business. 

All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Teona applied to MFO Credo for the credit. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, a joint initiative with Kiva, which permits poor people to start or re-start businesses. Teona will purchase clothing stock at wholesale prices and sell with price mark-ups in her community. She will get the chance to earn additional income and more effectively meet the family's daily costs. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: To start selling clothing and get additional income

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has 3 children.

With a portion of this loan, Esther will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Esther plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

In total, Esther’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Sacred Heart Girls School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Patricia, the Deputy Head teacher of Sacred Heart Girls School, a girls' school in the rural area of Sheema in Mbarara, with 750 students. Sacred Heart Girls School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Sacred Heart Girls School will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Patricia ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will increase the number of students coming to the school, and improve her students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma, 43 years old, is a hardworking woman who has 3 children. She has been providing sewing services in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Najma’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. Najma  has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase a new stitching machine, spools of threads and lace to meet her customers' demands consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, spools of threads and lace to meet her customers' demands consistently.

loans.name: Francisca Dolores

texts.es:
Francisca, de 51 años de edad, nunca tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, es viuda, su esposo murió hace varios años, tiene cuatro hijos, pero todos se acompañaron.

Francisca, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió con su papá, además de la siembra de maíz, le gusta mucho la crianza de ganado, a sus 51 años de edad, todavía trabaja con sus hijos en la siembra de maíz y pipían, sus cultivos están a 1 kilómetro de su casa y para llegar allá lo hace a pie, después de la muerte de esposo, tuvo que tomar toda la responsabilidad de su hogar, pero gracias  a Dios y a lo que le enseño su padre, ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos, ella no aprendió a leer, pero todos sus hijos son bachilleres, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. a 12:00 del mediodía, luego regresa a su casa para alimentar una vaca que tiene.

El crédito será invertido para comprar semilla, abono y veneno para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

Sus sueños son tener al menos 5 vacas lecheras, comprar un terreno para sembrar pasto y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisca is 51 years old and never had the opportunity to go to school. She is a widow, her husband died a number of years ago. She has 4 children, all of whom are married.

Francisca has worked farming all her life, which she learned from her father. Besides growing corn she likes to raise cattle. At 51 years of age she still works with her children planting corn and squash. Her crops are one km from her house and she gets there on foot.

After the death of her husband she had to assume all the responsibility for her house. And thanks to God what her father had taught her served her to manage to raise her children. She didn't learn to read but all her children has their secondary graduation. Her timetable is from 6 am until 12 noon, then she returns home to feed a cow she has.

The loan will be invested in buying seed, manure and poison to plant 7,000 sq meters of corn. Her dream is to have at least 5 milk cows, buy some land for grazing and make improvements on her house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and poison to plant 7,000 sq. meters of corn.

loans.name: Fátima Zuleyma

texts.es:
Fátima, de 22 años de edad, estudio asta séptimo grado, es madre soltera y vive con su niña de 6 meses de nacida, viven en casa de su mamá y una hermana. 

Fátima, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa desde hace 2 años, también compra semillas de marañón para venderla; anteriormente trabajaba como empleada domestica en casas particulares, para vender en la tienda le ayuda su mamá cuando ella no puede.- Ella se levanta temprano, porque sus clientes llegan muy temprano a comprar productos como café, pan y azúcar para desayunar. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar productos para la tienda como, detergentes, pan, café, azúcar, dulces, jugos y golosinas. 

El sueño de Fátima, es ver crecer a su hija y darle todo lo necesario para que estudie y se prepare academicamente.
texts.en:
Fátima is 22 years old and has a seventh-grade education. She is a single mother and lives with her six-month-old daughter. They live with Fátima’s mother and one of her sisters.

Fátima has had a small shop in her home for two years. She also buys cashew seeds to sell. Previously Fátima worked as a domestic servant in private houses.  Fátima’s mother helps out at the shop when Fátima cannot. Fátima wakes up very early as customers come early to buy products such as coffee, bread and sugar for breakfast.

Fátima will use this loan to buy products for her shop, including detergent, bread, coffee, sugar, sweets, juices and sweets.

Fátima’s dream is to see her daughter grow up and to give her everything that she needs so that she can get an education.

loans.use: to buy products for her shop, including, detergent, bread, coffee, sugar, sweets, juices and sweets.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres De Xoljuyup Group

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 25 años de edad, está unida con su esposo con el que tiene un hijo que se encuentra estudiando la primaria en la escuela de su comunidad, esta linda familia vive en Sololá.
Sandra (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía de blusa rosada) para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la compra y venta de banano en el lugar de su domicilio, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace 7 años.
Sandra ahora ha organizado a un grupo de mujeres para juntas solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en su negocio de banano pues ella ahora considera que es necesario surtir más su venta de banano para poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de la clientela.
El gran sueño de Sandra es que su negocio se haga más grande como un depósito de banano, para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 25 year old lady who has one child with her spouse. Her child is at the local primary school, in Sololá where this lovely family live.

Sandra (on the far right hand side of the photo in the pink blouse) buys and sells bananas from her home to obtain an income and to support her spouse with the household costs. She has been doing this for 7 years.

Sandra has now organised a group of ladies to request a loan together, which she will invest in her banana business, as she feels that she now needs more banana to be able to meet the needs of her customers.

Sandra's greatest wish is that she can expand her business with a banana stand, so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy and sell banana.

loans.name: Western School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Kikonyogo. He is the Head teacher of Western College School, a mixed school with 600 students in the Peri-Urban area of Mbarara. Western School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water to its students. The school does not currently have access to consistently clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Western School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Kikonyogo ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water to its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: in galvanized laminate, beams, fastening pins and cement to improve the roof of her house.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena es una mujer de 44 años de edad, está unida con su esposo con el que tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades de entre 3y 20 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Nahuala.
Magdalena con el  afán de generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos criollos en la plaza de su comunidad, este negocio lo tiene ella desde hace 7 años.
Esta gran mujer es una madre que se interesa  por las necesidades de su familia es por eso que ahora se ha dado cuenta que una de las más necesidades primordiales es la adquisición de un terreno, pues su familia no cuenta con suficiente terreno donde puedan construir, aunque una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no tiene el dinero suficiente para poder comprar una acuartilla de terreno por tal motivo solicita el préstamo para poder realizar la compra.
El gran sueño de Magdalena es poder comprar el terreno para luego construir una casa más grande para que su familia tenga un mejor hogar.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a 44-year-old woman. She is united with her husband, with whom she has a lovely family with five children between the ages of 3 and 20. This humble family lives in a community in Nahuala. 

Magdalena, with a desire to generate income and support her husband with the household expenses, makes a living by buying and selling Creole chickens in the plaza of her community. She has had this business for 7 years.

This great woman is a mother who worries about her family’s needs. For this reason, she has realized that one of their fundamental needs is to acquire a piece of land. Her family does not have enough land to build on, but Magdalena also does not have enough money to buy the land. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy it.

Magdalena’s greatest dream is to be able to buy the land to later build a larger house so that her family can have a better home.

loans.use: to buy land for future construction.

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
Ema is a 24-year-old young woman from Kutaisi city. She lives with her sister, and both are employed at the local store and generate a fixed salary. However, the income is hardly enough to meet all daily costs of the family and have financial stability. 

Ema decided to be involved in another business also. All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Ema applied for the credit from MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting poor people to start or restart businesses. 

Ema will purchase stock of clothing at wholesale prices and will sell it with price mark-ups in her community. She will get the chance to make an additional source of income and more effectively meet the daily costs of the family. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to trade in clothing and make another source of income

loans.name: Happy Tots School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jovia. She is the head teacher of Happy Tots School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Mbarara with 320 students. Happy Tots School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. 

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore, has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. 

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Happy Tots School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Jovia ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is an entrepreneur operating on a piece of land in the Molo region of Kenya. She keeps dairy cows, poultry and trees. At this point of her life, she is forced to work tirelessly to meet the family's growing needs. 

To keep providing adequately for her family, she decided to think outside the box and come up with a good business plan with favorable return on investment. She is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to start an agro-vet business. Her vision is for the business to be a leading enterprise in its category in the Nkubu area, offering farm inputs and animal feeds at affordable prices. 

She is anticipating many customers, as there is little competition in the area. She has already invested some of her own savings to get the business started. She plans to use your loan investment to purchase more items to stock the agro-vet. Through the income she projects from the agro-vet, she will be able to pay school fees and meet other needs of her family without much straining. Eunice is a great client to Juhudi Kilimo; she has a perfect credit risk score. All that Eunice is waiting for is your kindness.

loans.use: to start a business selling farm inputs and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel and laminate sheeting to build a garage at her house.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with four school-going children. They live at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (women's wraps) for resale

loans.name: Gaterin

texts.en:
Gaterin is a widowed woman with two kids, none of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Gaterin operates a grocery vegetables selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a veranda and bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Solomé

texts.fr: Solomé est une femme mariée de 56 ans et très entreprenante. Solomé vit à Adidogomé avec six enfants à sa charge. Solomé travaille activement pour leur favoriser une bonne éducation. Pour cela Solomé vend du maïs en gros dans son quartier pour trouver le revenu nécessaire. Solomé s’approvisionne une fois par mois marché. Pour commander des sacs de maïs, Solomé demande ce crédit pour financer son activité et réaliser plus de profits pour élever ses enfants avec épanouissement.
texts.en: Solomé is a 56-year old married woman who is very entrepreneurial.  Solomé lives in Adidogomé with six children under her care.  She actively works to give them a good education. To do so, Solomé sells corn wholesale in her neighborhood to earn the necessary income.  Solomé stocks up once a month at the market.  To order bags of corn, Solomé is asking for this loan to finance her business and to earn a larger profit to raise her children.

loans.use: to buy 12 bags of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick and rebar for building the wall of her home.

loans.name: Dogomnogo Ii Group

texts.fr:
Mme  CHANTAL  est responsable du groupe DOGOMNOGO II. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20 ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans. 05 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 07 personnes en charge.
Madame fait du maraichage  depuis  05 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent  octroyé, elle compte acheter 06 boîtes  de semence et 03 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour payer la scolarité de ses enfants et payer des équipements. Elle ambitionne acheter une moto pompe pour pouvoir exploiter des hectares et avoir une vie meilleure pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. CHANTAL is the official of the group DOGOMNOGO II. She is a married mother of seven children. The oldest is 20 years old, and the youngest is 7. Five children go to school. She has seven persons to support. 

Ms. CHANTAL has been a market-gardener for five years. She gets her supplies from nearby markets. With the money granted, she intends to purchase six cans of seeds and three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer. She want to use the profits from the loan to pay for her children’s schooling and some supplies and equipment. Her ambition is to purchase a motorized pump to make use of hectares of land and to have a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase six cans of seeds and three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Sheila's Group

texts.en:
Sheila, pictured above, has nine children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the leader of her group. Sheila is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Sheila has been a farmer for more than 50 years and, in order to earn enough to feed her family, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this coming season, Sheila is planning to buy a cow.

A total of six acres will be planted by Sheila's Group, and between them they will receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene dos hijos, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad dedicada al comercio y agricultura que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Maria tiene su bodega en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, se dedica a este negocio hace 1 año, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, etc, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto le servirá para tener mayor variedad en lo concerniente a productos, con la finalidad de poder satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y así poder incrementar sus ventas lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old, is in a relationship, has two children, and lives in a house with her family in a rural area of the district of Oyotún, a community dedicated to commerce and agriculture located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.

Maria has a store where she sells products of basic need like rice, sugar, oil, and noodles, among other items. She has had this business for a year and it is located in her home. She is asking for a loan to invest in buying a greater quantity of rice, sugar, noodles, oil, etc., in order to increase her business' stock. This will allow her to have a greater variety of products in order to satisfy her customers' tastes and thus increase her sales, which will generate better earnings to allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in buying a greater quantity of rice, sugar, noodles, oil, etc., in order to increase her business' stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hook up to the sewer system and install a toilet to be able to live in her house with her child.

loans.name: Adina

texts.es:
Adina tiene 34 años de edad, es separada, vive junto a sus 05 hijos en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, además también se dedica a la venta de cerveza y chicha de jora, cuenta con más de 04 años de experiencia en el rubro por lo que cuenta con bastante clientela quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir su negocio, con esto Adina espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ventas y le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Adina is 34 years old, separated, and lives with her 5 children in Pucará district, which is located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The population of this district works primarily in agriculture, business and raising animals. 

She works in business, and has a store located in her home. In addition, she sells beer and corn chicha. She has more than 4 years of experience in the field, so she has many customers who offer very good personal and work references for her. The loan will be used to purchase a larger quantity of merchandise to stock her business. With this, Adina hopes to offer a better variety of products to her customers, which will increase her level of sales and allow her to get more income which will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una madre de familia de 51 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de nueve hijos de las edades entre ocho y veinte años, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuela para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, se dedica  a la compra y venta de ropa típica de su región en la plaza de su comunidad, este negocio lo tiene ella desde hace cuatro años.
Manuela por la calidad de sus telas y con la amabilidad con la que atiende a las personas, tiene mucha demanda, por lo que ahora se le es necesario surtir más su negocio, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder realizar la inversión, por tal motivo solicita un crédito que lo invertirá comprando güipiles, cortes, fajas, sutes, y delantales para luego venderlos a un buen precio.
El gran sueño de Manuela es que su negocio prospere para poder mejorar sus ingresos y comprar un terreno donde pueda cultivar café así también abrir una tienda de compra y venta de abarrotería.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 51-year-old mother. She is married and has a lovely family with nine children between the ages of eight and twenty. They live in a community in Sololá. 

Manuela, to generate income and support her husband with the household expenses, makes a living by buying and selling traditional clothes of her region in her plaza’s community. She has had this business for four years.

Because of the quality of her fabrics and her kindness when dealing with people, she has a lot of demand. For this reason, it is becoming necessary to stock her business more. However, one of the challenges she has is that she doesn’t have enough capital to make the investment. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy traditional tunics/blouses, traditional skirts, woven belts, sutes (wraps to swaddle babies), and aprons, to later sell them at a good price.

Manuela’s biggest dream is for her business to prosper so that she can improve her income and buy a piece of land where she can grow coffee. Also, she would like to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing such as traditional tunics/blouses, traditional skirts, woven belts, sutes (wraps to swaddle babies), and aprons.

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
Jose tiene 43 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa y sus 02 hijos en el distrito de Colasay, una comunidad donde la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a elaborar muebles de madera, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de madera y nuevas herramientas como martillos, clavos, pintura, entre otros, para implementar su negocio. Esta inversión le permitirá ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 43 yeas old, and lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his wife and their 2 children in Colasay district, a community where the population works in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry, which is located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works making wood furniture and has experience in this business and good references from his neighbors. The loan will be used to invest in the purchase a greater quantity of wood and new tools such as hammers, nails, paint, and more, to supply his business. This investment will permit him to have earnings to improve his economic condition and in the end to invest in better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of wood and new tools such as hammers, nails, paint, and more, to supply his business.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a widowed mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Tufanisso

texts.ru: Туфаниссо, 51 год, вдова, 2 детей. У Туфаниссо среднее образование, уже 20 лет в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть корова, 1,0 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает картофель. Туфаниссо известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь Туфаниссо, поэтому она решила развить свою деятельность и обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку двух телят. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и улучшение материального положения семьи.
texts.en: Tufanisso is a 51 year old widow with two children. She has a secondary education, and for the past twenty years farming has provided her primary source of income. Her farm includes one cow, and 1 hectare of irrigated land where she grows potatoes. Tufanisso is known to be a principled, honest, respectable, and reliable person. Her work currently earns her a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS), which is completely insufficient for a fitting livelihood, so she decided to expand her activities. She is asking Bai Tushum Bank for a 50,000 som (KGS) loan to spend on buying two calves. She plans to use the income generated from the loan to develop her farm and improve her family's financial position.

loans.use: to buy two calves in order to increase her income

loans.name: Janepher's Group

texts.en:
Janepher, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Janepher will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life. Janepher plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Janepher’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of six acres of land. They will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Patzulin Group

texts.es:
Antonio (el primero del lado izquierdo de playera blanca) es un padre de familia de 59 años de edad, esta simplemente unido con su esposa con la que tiene dos hijos de las edades entre 18 y 22 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Antonio es un padre que le preocupa las necesidades de su familia y para que no parezcan de ellas se dedica  a la venta de café en la plaza de  su comunidad, esta labor lo realiza desde hace quince años.
Antonio ahora le preocupa que para esta temporada  no pueda darle el mantenimiento que su cultivo de café necesita, porque no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder pagar la mano de obra y comprar su abono orgánico como químico, pero él es un hombre optimista y un buen líder, por lo que la gente confía mucho en él, es por eso que ahora  junto a un grupo de campesinos que tienen las mismas necesidades solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá pagando la mano de obra y comprando su abono orgánico y químico.
El gran sueño de Antonio es poder conseguir el crédito, para poder sacar esta cosecha y mejorar sus ingresos para poder seguir cultivando café de su región.
texts.en:
Antonio (the first on the left, with a white t-shirt) is a 59-year-old father. He is simply united with his wife with whom he has 2 children between the ages of 18 and 22. This humble family lives in a community of Sololá.

Antonio is a father who is concerned about his family's needs and so that they don't seem to have them, he works selling coffee in the plaza of his community. This work he has done for fifteen years. 

Antonio now is worried because for this season he can't provide the care his coffee crop needs, because he doesn't have enough money to be able to pay labor costs and to purchase manure and chemical fertilizer. But, he is an optimistic man and a good leader, so people trust him a lot. For this reason, he now gathered a group of rural people who have the same needs to ask for a loan with he will invest in paying labor costs and purchasing his manure and chemical fertilizer. 

Antonio's great dream is to be able to get the loan to be able to get this harvest and improve his income to be able to continue growing the coffee of his region.

loans.use: to purchase manure, chemical fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 34 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre y su hijo desde hace varios años, por lo que es muy conocida por sus vecinos como una persona responsable y trabajadora. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia poniendo todo su esfuerzo. María desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible y de esta manera evitar que sus pertenencias se deterioren, por las filtraciones de agua.
texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old and for many years has lived in her own home along with her mother and her son. She is known by her neighbors as a responsible and hardworking woman. She is an entrepreneurial woman who, for a long time, has made a living by providing domestic services. This has allowed her to help her family get ahead by using all of her strength. 

Maria wants to replace the roof of her house. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails. This will let her replace the roof of her house as soon as possible and, this way, prevent her belongings from deteriorating due to water leaks.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia Irene se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania y crianza de animales, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Irene still has her crafts business and raises animals; she sells various fabrics, sweaters, blankets and looms. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.; she has had this business for 8 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand the business selling fabrics and looms. She is asking for the loan to buy fabrics, sweaters and looms. 

Irene is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
Шухрат 43 летный житель района Спитамен. Он женат и отец двоих детей. У него один сын и одна дочка. Жена занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Его сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, он каждый месяц отправляет родителям денег, чтобы помочь им обеспечит семью. Дочка занимается швеей дома. Сам Шухрат 3 занимается земледелием уже 3 года. У него имеется 0.10 Га земельный участок, где он выращивает рис. 
Сейчас Шухрат хочет начать новый бизнес, животноводство. Шухрат просит кредит для купли скота. У него есть  коровник, где он будет ухаживать о домашних животных. Ему нравится домашние животные, по этой причине он хочет заниматься животноводством. Шухрат с большими надеждами обратился к Вам за кредитом. Он заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Shuhrat is 43 and lives in the Spitamen district. He is married and is the father of two children. He has a son and a daughter. His wife is a farmer and his son is working in Russia, sending money home each month to his parents in order to help take care of the family. His daughter is a seamstress and works at home. Shuhrat himself has been planting crops for three years already and has a 0.1 hectare plot of land where he grows rice. 

Now Shuhrat wants to start a new livestock business. He is applying for a loan to buy livestock. He has a barn where he will take care of the animals. He likes animals and this is why he wants to raise livestock. Shuhrat has high hopes for the loan and expresses his gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start a new business

loans.name: Mohirahon

texts.ru: Мохирахон, 42 года, замужем, есть 3 детей. Мохирахон в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи с 1992 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 5 коров и 1,20 Га собственной земельной доли, где Мохирахон выращивает рис для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду Мохирахон и ее дружной семьи, бизнес приносит ежемесячную прибыль до 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мохирахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Мохирахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Mohirahon is 42, married, and has three children. Mohirahon has earned the main income for her family since 1992 by raising livestock and planting crops. She has five cows on her farm and a 1.20 hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell. Thanks to her hard work and her helpful family, the business earns a monthy income of around 18,000 som (KGS). In order to expand her business, Mohirahon applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in continuing to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Margubahon

texts.ru: Маргубахон, 37 лет, замужем. Имеет 3 детей школьного возраста. Семья очень дружная и уважаемая. У Маргубахон среднее образование, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Бизнес Маргубахон начала 15 лет назад, на сегодняшний день она успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, в котором у нее имеется: 3 овцы. На 0,18 Га земли выращивает картофель и помидоры. Ежемесячная прибыль Маргубахон составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Всю прибыль от хозяйства она старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Маргубахон обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и семян картофеля. Она хочет развить свою деятельность и построить теплицу.
texts.en: Margubahon is 37, married, and has three school-age children. Her family is close-knit and respectable. She has a high school education and raises livestock and plants crops. She started a business 15 years ago and now she is a successful farmer with a small farm of three sheep and a 0.18 hectare plot of land where she plants potatoes and tomatoes. She earns around 10,000 som (KGS) per month. She tries to invest the farm’s profits in developing her business. Margubahon applied for a loan with Bai Tushum Bank in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer and seed potatoes. She wants to expand her business and build a greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes and fertilizer in order to grow organic produce

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венера, 40 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей школьного возраста, которые с радостью помогают по хозяйству. У Венеры средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав бизнес в 2004 году. На данный момент в бизнесе Венеры имеется 2 коровы и 18 овец и коз. Также выращивает ячмень и люцерну. Хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Венера обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена и ячменя в качестве корма для скота. Это позволит сохранить и приумножить поголовье. Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, что позволит накопить на будущее обучение ее детей в университете.
texts.en: Venera is 40, married, and the mother of four school-age children who happily help her on the farm. Venera has a vocational education and earns the main income for her family by raising livestock and planting crops, having started a business in 2004. She currently has two cows and 18 sheep and goats and also grows barley and alfalfa. Her farm earns around 6,000 som (KGS) per month. Venera applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy hay and barley as feed for the livestock. This will help her to maintain and increase her herd. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in additional livestock and save money to send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy feed and hay for her livestock

loans.name: Elzat

texts.ru: Эльзат, 27 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. Образование у Эльзат- среднее, она занимается полеводством, выращивая на 0,52 Га земли картофель. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). Эльзат обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля. Доходы от кредита она направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Elzat is 27, married and has two children. She has a high school education and grows crops for a living. She plants potatoes on a 0.52 hectare plot of land and earns around 8,000 som (KGS) per month. Elzat applied for a loan of 10,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy seed potatoes. She will use the earnings from the loan to continue to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes in order to grow an organic crop

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 45 years old and has seven children. She has been a farmer for 15 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Beatrice is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by nine farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Beatrice started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Beatrice’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 58 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by nine farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Rose has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2008. This decision was largely the result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rose also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Rose's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia Sabina se dedica al negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maiz,cacao y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cacao, maíz y quinua.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabina makes a living by selling grains; she sells corn, cocoa and quinoa. She works from 8:00 a.m to 5:00 p.m.; she has had this business for 4 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her grains. She is asking for the loan to buy cocoa, corn and quinoa.

Sabina is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy cocoa, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Lizette Matilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Lizette Matilde se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belong to the communal bank 'REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS'. The bank is located in the district of Huayllabamba, in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

This member is called Lizette Matilde and earns a living selling food. She makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soups and stir-frys. She works from 8am to 6pm. She has been doing this for 8 years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is asking for this loan to buy products to cook such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

This member is very happy to have this loan and is committed to paying the repayments.

loans.use: to buy products to cook such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is married with seven children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She operates a bar where she deals in buying and selling spirits, and gets additional income from cocoa growing. She started the business two years ago and so far the profits are good. She is hardworking and plans to expand the business, but faces hardships of competition and dishonest customers with high default rates. This affects her profits. Lydia has requested a loan to buy spirits to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy spirits and liquor to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sanairi

texts.en: Sanairi is a 40-year-old man, married with ten children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He sells general merchandise, and at the same time owns a coffee plantation and nursery beds for trees which adds more income for him. He is faced with a challenge of limited capital that hinders the progress of his business. Besides that, he has hopes of building a residential house. Sanairi has asked for a loan to buy general merchandise like bread, sugar and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like bread, sugar and others to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes Jacinta

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Andrés De Vera De Miraflores.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 12 (gemelos), 7 y 4  años de edad. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Mercedes con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar con los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  trabaja todos los días por ratos ya que ella no cuenta con horarios fijos, también vende en su casa cuando algún cliente necesita de alguna prenda, ella lleva más de 7  años en su negocio el cual le da para salir adelante cuando su marido no tiene trabajo ya que en ocasiones el trabajo en el campo de la construcción es muy limitado. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho a ella y a su familia. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the Andrés de Vera parish of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Andrés de Vera de Miraflores loan group meet every two weeks. This is where Mercedes lives. She is 35 years old, is in a relationship, and from this relationship she has four children ages 12 (twins), 7 and 4. Her husband is a stonemason.

In order to have her own income and thus help with household expenses, Mercedes makes a living by selling all kinds of clothing door-to-door. She works every day for a while; she doesn't have set hours. She also sells at home when any customers need clothing. She has had her business for more than 7 years, and it has allowed her to get ahead when her husband doesn't have work, since work in the construction field is sometimes very limited. 

She is going to use this loan to buy all kinds of clothing. She has been in the loan group from the beginning, and she likes it because the loans help her and her family a lot. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Calvary School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Molline. She is the Director of Calvary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Nyamityobora in Mbarara with 1,000 students.

Calvary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Calvary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Molline ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 23 year old married woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in selling cocoa and rice, and gets additional income from cocoa growing. She started the business to get income to supplement her husband's earnings.

She works hard and has plans to buy land for farming but faces high competition, price changes and long distances to markets. Eva wants a loan to buy cocoa for selling to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling to her customers.

loans.name: Analonga Group

texts.en:
Otilia is married and a mother of three children. She owns a grocery shop and a tea room in her community. She runs this business in order to improve her family’s living standards and to pay school fees for her children.

She will use the loan to buy commodities that are needed in her tea room and to buy assorted items for her grocery.

She plans to hire someone to assist her in running her business and she has hopes of building a better house for her family. Since she started obtaining the loans she has experienced change as her business has grown bigger than before and she is now able to provide her children with school requirements.

loans.use: to buy bread, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 48 years old. She makes and sells brushes to the public. She starts her work at 8:00 am, and she goes to the street to sell her products every Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday.

Adela has her own house, and she needs a loan to buy materials that will help her to make more brushes. Adela would like to have her own workshop in the future. Right now she works at her house and that is very uncomfortable for her. Adela was married but her husband left her, so she is alone.

loans.use: to buy materials that will help her to make more brushes

loans.name: Kisha

texts.en:
After observing a lack of affordable electronics and computer training programs available to people in her community, Kisha decided to start a family business refurbishing and reselling electronics and offering computer training classes. 

Kisha is originally from the Bronx, NY, and has lived in the United States her entire life. With the help of her husband and son, she has enhanced the technological resources of people in her community. Her company allows her and her husband to support her three children, one of which is in college. Her children inspire her, Kisha says, and she wants to leave a legacy of hard work and community enhancement that they can be proud of. 

Her greatest success has been the ability of her company to jump-start the success of youth in her community. Technology and computer expertise are invaluable skills in today’s workforce, and her company allows individuals to gain these skills and potentially gain better jobs in the future. 

However, Kisha has struggled finding funds to support and expand her business. With this loan, she will expand her inventory, purchase equipment for her computer classes, and start an advertising campaign. She also plans to use a portion to participate in local computer trade shows. Her overall goal is to provide people of low-income backgrounds with computer skills and products to enhance and advance their lives.

loans.use: to purchase modules and programs for computer classes, and fund advertising efforts for her electronics store

loans.name: Zoila Eliomar

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija de 20 años que estudia en universidad.  El marido es comerciante y chofer. 
Doña Zoila es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse la vida a base de trabajo, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí mismo ella junto a su marido también se dedican a la venta de deliciosos encebollados que ella prepara y que son del agrado de los clientes que a diario asisten a su negocio. Con la ayuda de los créditos ella ha podido de a poco ir mejorando su negocio y su calidad de vida por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que así ellos pueden ganarse la vida y así salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar sillas, mesas y víveres para su negocio de venta de encebollados. Lleva más de 5 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la fundación. Sus sueños son ir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Crucita loan group meet in the Crucita parish of the Portoviejo canton. This lovely place is known for the beautiful beaches that surround it and are often visited by domestic and foreign tourists. It is known as “Crucita the Beautiful”.

Zoila lives here. She is 44 years old, is married, and has a 20-year-old daughter who is studying at university. Her husband is a merchant and a driver. Zoila is a woman who has always liked to earn a living by working. She has a store selling food in her home; along with her husband she makes a living by selling the delicious traditional fish and onion stew that she prepares and that all of the customers who come to her business on a daily basis like.

With the help of the loans she has been able to improve her business and her quality of life little by little. She is very grateful for this as they are able to earn a living in this way and thus get ahead. This loan is to buy chairs, tables and food for her business selling fish stew. She has been in the loan group for more than 5 years and she likes it because of the help that the foundation provides her. Her dream is to keep improving her business.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and food

loans.name: María Narciza

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 57 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos mayores de edad, cinco de ellos aun viven con ella. El marido es chofer y también se dedica a la pesca.
Doña María realiza los créditos para que su marido lo utilice en sus actividades, el actualmente tiene un bus de transporte en el cual todos los días realiza trasporte de personas desde Portoviejo a Crucita, este medio de transporte requiere de muchos arreglos y mantenimiento para ofrecer un mejor servicio. Ellos de a poco y con la ayuda de los créditos han ido mejorando su vida y adquiriendo nuevos medios para salir adelante.  
Este crédito es para comprar llantas y repuestos que necesita para mejorar el bus de transporte.  Ella lleva más de 10  años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The members of the Crucita credit group meet in the parish church in the Portoviejo district.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and for the many domestic and foreign tourists that visit them.  It is known as “Crucita la Bella.”

Maria lives here.  She is 57 years old and lives in a common law marriage from which she has seven older children, five of whom still live with her.  Her husband is a driver and also makes a living fishing.  Maria takes out the loans so that her husband can use them in his professions.  He currently has a shuttle bus that he uses to transport people every day from Portoviejo to Crucita.  This mode of transport requires many repairs and maintenance in order to provide a better service.  Little by little and with the help of the loans, they have improved their lives and obtained new means in order to move forward in life.

This loan is to purchase tires and spare parts that she needs to repair the shuttle bus.  She has been in this credit group for over 10 years and she likes it because of the benefits that she receives from the institution.  Her dream is to continue improving her life.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, Kenya, which is a town near the famous Rift Valley. Emily and her husband are blessed with a child. Emily has been a farmer for more than 4 years. She keeps poultry for eggs and grows maize and vegetables for sale.
