She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Emily is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya. Emily is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer. This move is quite a big deal for her. With a loan, Emily seeks to continue growing a variety of crops but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kitale and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my child.”

loans.use: To expand her farm by buying good quality seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulls for slaughtering.

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en: Phanice is a 47-year-old woman from the Kitale area of Kenya. She has been married to her husband for 13 years and they have 8 children! The youngest child is 8 years old while the oldest is 22 years old. Phanice has been a farmer for as long as she has been a wife. She operates on a small piece of land under her husband's name, keeping dairy and poultry and growing crops and trees. Phanice is seeking a small loan of KES 10,000 to pay for farm implements. Working with modern tools will make her work move faster and become more efficient. She expects to see major improvements in the quality and quantity of yields led by the use of improved tools.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sportswear to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 34-year-old divorced woman with children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She took a loan of 800,000 UGX and paid it off well. She deals in foodstuffs, and she used the old loan to expand on her stock.

She is very hardworking, but is challenged by inadequate capital. Sarah has requested a loan to continue increasing her stock and meet the high demand for her foodstuffs, such as bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs such as bananas to sell.

loans.name: Benedita

texts.en:
Benedita is from the town of Likoni. She’s a very hard-working person who has always worked and striven to reach her goals and objectives. She defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants.

Benedita owns a food cafe in downtown Likoni. She’s had it for more than 10 years. She said it has attained good renown in the neighborhood and, thanks to that, she has a good clientele.

Benedita is asking for this loan to purchase tomatoes, onions, chicken, rice, cooking oil and other products to stock her store so she can have good products to offer her customers. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, chicken, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a divorced woman staying with her one child, who is a grownup. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman and has three kids who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mary has operated a tailoring business for the past 6 years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Chadzumbe

texts.en:
Chadzumbe is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over three years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. In addition, she also sell juice. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get a biogas system to expand his farm and opportunities for his family

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Ruharo Vocational School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Amon. He is the Principal of Ruharo Vocational School, a mixed school in the Peri urban area of Mbarara with 520 students. Ruharo Vocational School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Ruharo Vocational School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Amon ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Asmati

texts.en:
Asmati, who is a 45-year-old married woman, lives with her husband and son. The family members generate a fixed salary except Asmati, who has her own poultry farm and gets income from selling eggs locally. She wants to expand the agribusiness and start dairy farming, which is a really profitable business in this kind of area.  

Asmati lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require a stable income. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Asmati to get a loan of 5000 GEL and start dairy farming. She will build a cattle shed and will purchase milk cows. Asmati will produce milk products and will sell eggs.

With support of the Start Up program, Asmati will get an opportunity to expand her own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: To build a cattle shed and start dairy farming

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa es una señora casada, esta en los 48 años de edad, Rosa tiene 5 hijos, la de 16 es mujer y los de 23, 21, 12 y 5 años son hombres, de sus hijos son 3 los que asisten a un centro educativo, el esposo de  Rosa  se dedica al jornal y le apoya en la crianza de animales menores a ella, Rosa siempre ha vivido con bajos recursos económicos y por este motivo sus hijos mayores  apenas terminaron sus estudios básicos y en la actualidad se dedican a  trabajar de jornaleros de trabajos del campo, Rosa necesita el dinero del crédito para realizar la compra de chanchos, y comenta Rosa que su mayor aspiración es la de mejorar su negocio para darle la educación a sus hijos  que en la actualidad están estudiando.
texts.en: Rosa is a 48-year-old married woman. She has five children; her 16-year-old is a girl and her sons are 23, 21, 12 and 5 years old. Three of her children are in school. Rosa's husband makes a living as a day worker and supports her in raising small animals. Rosa has always lived with few financial resources and so her older sons were only able to finish elementary school. They are currently working as day workers in the fields. Rosa needs the money from the loan to buy pigs, and she says her greatest aspiration is to improve her business to give her children who are currently studying an education.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Yubel Gonzalez

texts.en:
Bella Caracas Café is a little piece of Venezuela tucked away in the heart of Queens. It was started one and a half years ago by Yubel, a native of Caracas who hoped to use his love of cooking to expose New Yorkers and tourists to the cuisine and culture of his homeland. 

From an early age, Yubel’s parents instilled in him the value of being independent. This colored his decision to open his own restaurant with his wife and a friend. As with many new business owners, he has struggled with having enough capital to increase sales and publicity. With this loan, he will have enough working capital to invest and further the success of his restaurant. His future goals are to have a prosperous restaurant and be a leading player in the New York City restaurant sector. He is also determined to create employment opportunities in his community with his restaurant businesses.

Check out his restaurant at www.bellacaracascafe.com.

loans.use: to increase advertising and marketing efforts for his restaurant

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson knows that obtaining insurance is a process that many people find daunting and uncertain. A seven-year veteran of the insurance industry, he helps people in his community to quickly and efficiently find the best insurance company for their situation. With his new business, Community Insurance Connections, LLC, he uses his myriad connections to diverse insurance companies to offer a wide variety of services for his clients.

Originally from Haiti, Jackson moved to the U.S. nineteen years ago, and lived most of his life in Miami, FL. He started his own business less than a year ago, and employs two independent contractors. He hopes to reach his profit goal by the end of his first year, and maintain his good reputation within his community. He plans to open a storefront and call center within his business’ first year, as well. 

With this loan, Jackson will be able to purchase supplies, invest in insurance leads, and increase marketing efforts for his company.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and insurance leads for his insurance provider company

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 46 years old, and he is a mason. Antonio is a hardworking man, and he needs a loan to build up a couple of rooms because he would like to have tenants, and that is the chance for him to make extra money.

Antonio has his own house, and he would like to have a construction company in the future. Antonio lives with his daughter; she sells toilet paper, but Antonio is the main support at the home. 

As you can see in the picture, the adobe walls of Antonio's house need to go.

loans.use: to build up a couple of rooms to have tenants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, purloins, and pins to improve the roof of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rebuild her credit history and improve her ability to expand her salon and spa

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cassava flour and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a single mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby.

She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 35,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman; she has three children, all of whom attend school. Josephine lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Josephine operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Jane,

texts.en:
Jane is a 44-year-old woman. She is married with five children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. Jane is a salary earner and also gets additional income from selling salt.

She always desires her children to get the best education up to university level and to have a well built home. However, she is faced with the challenge of delays in salary payments.

Jane has asked for a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials, increase marketing efforts, and pay for studio space for her yarn-dyeing business.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is 25 years old and married with two children. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She trades in clothes, mainly buying and selling to men and women. She earns additional income from a cocoa business. She started the business five years ago and is proud of the progress, although challenged by increasing transport costs and limited capital.

Scovia hopes to expand her clothing business in the future into a renowned, fully-stocked boutique with the latest designs, which her clients desire. Scovia has requested a loan of 400,000 shillings to buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is a 36-year-old married man from the village of Paldo. He lives with his wife and earns a living mostly with agribusiness. He cares for cattle, produces milk products, and sells cattle at the local market. To make his income more stable, Ramil also started working as a taxi driver serving local people.

However, Ramil's income is hardly enough to tackle his financial difficulties, so he decided to expand his agribusiness and make it more profitable. Ramil sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions.

This startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. Under the framework of this program, Ramil's application was approved for a loan of 5,000 GEL to cultivate a plot of agricultural land and plant maize. Seasonally, Ramil will sell harvested maize at the local market for a good price.

This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income, and they will be able to improve their living condition.

loans.use: To cultivate maize and sell it seasonally

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Carlos es un joven de 23 años de edad, vive con sus padres y con sus 3 hermanos que se encuentran estudiando, Carlos se dedica a trabajar al jornal y a la crianza de animales menores y el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos que los tiene en chancheras que le presta en la casa de donde vive que es de su hermano, Carlos tiene la aspiración de seguir adelante en su negocio y trabajar duro para mejorar la calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en: Carlos is a 23-year-old young man who lives with his parents and three siblings who are studying. Carlos makes a living as a day worker and by raising small animals. He is going to invest the money from the loan in buying pigs. He has the pigs in pens loaned to him at his brother's house. Carlos aspires to get ahead in his business and to work hard to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Teresa Alexandra

texts.es: A su corta edad que son 18 años Teresa esta casada y tiene una hija de 1 año, Teresa vive en la casa de su suegra, el esposo de Teresa trabaja de obrero en un planta florícola, Teresa se dedica a  la crianza de animales menores y comenta que este negocio es bueno porque le queda tiempo para cuidar a su hija, Teresa necesita el crédito para invertir en la compra de  pollos que los tiene en un corral, lo que Teresa espera es seguir incrementando su negocio y junto a su esposo luchar por el bienestar de su pequeña hija y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
At the young age of 18, Teresa is married and has a one-year-old daughter.  Teresa lives in her mother-in-law’s house.  Teresa’s husband works as a laborer in a flower nursery.  

Teresa works raising young animals.  She says that this business is good because it leaves her time to take care of her daughter.  

Teresa needs this loan to invest in the purchase of chickens, which she keeps in a corral.  Teresa hopes to keep expanding her business and, together with her husband, to fight for the well-being of their little girl, improving the quality of life of their family.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Mrs. Patricia is 60 years old, married and has four grown and independent sons. She lives with her family and works making and cooking deserts. She says that she has been in this business for over 20 years and her biggest achievement has been helping her husband and providing some financial stability for her children.

She is asking for a loan to make some fixes in her home.

loans.use: to perform home improvement

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.en:
Victor Manuel is 32 years old, married and has three sons. He lives with her parents and family and has been selling clothes for more than 11 years. He started by selling baby clothes, but currently he focuses on men's and women's underwear and socks. 

He js asking for a loan to buy more products and have a more varied inventory to offer his clients. He sells mostly in different Mexican city flea markets.  His biggest accomplishment is providing financial stability for his family and buying a piece of land. His goal is to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's underwear and socks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system to substitute the use of kerosene while providing better and safer light.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a 15W solar home system to substitute the use of candles and wood. Her children will be able to study for more hours.

loans.name: Keiner José

texts.es: Keiner José, tiene la edad  de 20 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de repuestos originales de de la mejor calidad para la reparación de la motocicleta, el cual es utilizado en el trasporte hacia su trabajo, además pagar mano de obra en los trabajos de reparación del vehículo, y de esta manera se estará asegurando de realizar un buen trabajo y que le dure un tiempo largo. Además de poder aprovechar de comprar algunos repuestos de buena calidad y que están en oferta, de esta manera espera seguir realizando los trabajos con más eficiencia y sin atraso por falta de trasporte. Con el ingreso espera seguir utilizándolo en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir mejorando su vehículo. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Keiner José is 20 years old, is single, and lives with his parents and his siblings, who are his highest priority. With his loan he intends to buy original replacement parts of the highest quality to repair his motorcycle, which he uses for transport to his job, and to pay for the labor to repair his vehicle. In this way he will ensure that they do a good job and that it lasts for a long time. In addition to taking advantage of buying good-quality parts that are on sale, he hopes to keep doing his job more efficiently and not be late due to a lack of transportation. With his earnings he hopes to keep improving his family's well being and studies, to achieve some of his family's goals, and to keep improving his vehicle. 

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had any other loans at state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle for work

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La señora Elena vive en el departamento de Cochabamba,tiene 2 hijos que depende económicamente de ella, la señora es de Chuquisaca pero se vino al trópico en busca de una mejor oportunidad de vida para su familia junto a su cónyuge, actualmente tiene un lote urbano y un lote agrícola, ambos son personas responsables y trabajan arduamente en su propio lote, su actividad económica es la producción de yuca y ahora tiene en producción una hectárea y media, la señora solicita un crédito para el mantenimiento y ampliación de su producción de yuca a fin de generar mayores ingresos y así solventar los gastos de su familia.
texts.en: Elena lives in the department of Cochabamba and has 2 children who depend on her financially. She is from Chuquisaca but she came to the tropics along with her partner seeking better life opportunities for her family. She currently has an urban lot and a plot of land for agriculture. She and her partner are both responsible people and work hard on their land. Her business is the production of cassava, and she now has a hectare and a half of land in production. She is asking for a loan to maintain and expand her cassava production in order to generate greater earnings to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to maintain and expand her cassava production in order to generate greater earnings to cover her family's expenses.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 70 años de edad, hace tiempo atrás su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes. 
Doña Mariana es una mujer que siempre le ha tocado trabajar para salir adelante, y más después de la muerte de su querido esposo que siempre le ayudaba en sus actividades, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa allí ella se gana la vida vendiendo una gran variedad de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, productos de bazar, helados, etc. Ella cada vez que recibe los créditos surte aun mas su negocio razón por lo cual cuenta con mucha clientela que siempre visitan su local.  Lleva más de 32 años con su tienda y agradece que la institución le ayude con los créditos ya que es su forma de financiarse y salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite,  licores y otros productos de primera necesidad.  Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The ladies of the “Crucita” Credit Group meet in Crucita Parish, in the Portoviejo Canton.  This town is known for its beautiful beaches, which surround this lovely place, and are much visited by domestic and international tourists. It is known by the name, “Crucita la Bella” [Crucita the beautiful].

Señora Mariana lives here.  She is 70 years old, and her husband passed away a while ago, but they have two children from their marriage, who are grown up and independent. Mariana is a woman who has always worked to make progress, even more so after the death of her beloved husband, who had always helped her with her activities. She has a grocery store in her house, and there, she earns a living selling a great variety of products, such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, legumes, market products, ice cream, etc.

Every time she receives a loan, she stocks her business even more, which is the reason that she has many customers who always visit her store.  She has had her store for more than 32 years, and she is thankful that the institution helps her with the loans, as that is her way of financing herself and making progress. She is going to use this loan to further stock her store; she will buy rice, sugar, oil, spirits, and other basic products. 

She is a founding member of the credit group, and she likes it for the services that the institution offers.  Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, spirits, and other basic products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand inventory for her online clothing boutique

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol started her own insurance sales company in December of 2014 to provide life insurance options for people with mortgages, final expenses, and annuities. Before starting her business, she had worked in the information technology (IT) sector for almost 20 years. She started selling insurance to earn extra money, but as she became more and more successful, she saw the potential to earn a solid income and decided to start a career in the insurance sector.  She continues to work in IT, but hopes to grow her business enough to transition completely away from IT and into insurance sales in the near future.

As a single mother, she works hard to bring in enough income to support herself and her daughter. With regards to her business, her greatest success has been successfully helping people protect their most valuable assets. However, she has encountered the difficulty of purchasing leads up front and juggling caring for her child and her career.

This loan will go towards purchasing insurance leads, a cell phone, business transportation, and marketing/advertising efforts. She plans to hire several other agents in the near future, and in particular, hopes to provide employment options for single mothers, allowing them to make a solid income and spend more time with their children.

loans.use: to pay for insurance leads, a cell phone, and marketing initiatives for her life insurance company

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilou is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marilou has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers.

Marilou has been in this business for five years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maritta

texts.en:
Maritta works hard to support her family. Maritta is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Maritta requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maritta has been in this business for four years now.

Maritta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mercedita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear.  Mercedita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks like canned goods, snack foods, beer, cereals, coffee, detergent soap, etc., to sell.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like canned goods, snack foods, beer, cereals, coffee, detergent soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Xiomara nació en una comunidad llamada San Antonio en el año de 1967. En la escuela de la comunidad ella estudio hasta cuarto grado. Aprendió de la madre las labores del hogar.Actualmente esta casada y tiene 4 hijos Ella y su familia se dedican a labores de agricultura y ganadería. Comenta doña Xiomara que de sus padres adquirió consejos y le sirvieron de mucho ya que en la casa se vive con mucha paz y tranquilidad con sus hijos y su esposo. Con mucho esfuerzo pudieron hacer una casa para vivir pero en el lugar donde viven no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y que este sea instalado en la casa de habitación, este sistema solar será de gran beneficio para todos los miembros del hogar ya que se podrán alumbrar con luz producida por este sistema solar ya que actualmente se tiene que estar alumbrando con candelas y foco. Ella estaría muy agradecida si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en:
Doña Xiomara was born in the community of San Antonio in 1967. She attended the school in her community through the fourth grade. Xiomara learned how to perform the household chores from her mother. She is now married and has four children. Xiomara and her family work in agriculture and raise livestock. She says that the advice she received from her parents was a great help since she now has a peaceful and tranquil life at home with her husband and children.

With great effort, Xiomara was able to create a home in which to live but her house does not have electricity. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can purchase a solar energy system and have it installed in her home. A solar energy system would be a great benefit because of all of her family members will be able to have light that is produced by the system. They currently rely on the use of candles and flashlights.

Xiomara is extremely grateful to have the opportunity to apply for this loan so that she can purchase a solar energy system.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system for her home.

loans.name: Nelson Miguel

texts.es:
Nelson es soltero y padre de tres hijos; desde hace aproximadamente 15 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para el sustento de su familia; ofrece todo tipo de productos como ropa, perfumería, cremas corporales, accesorios, entre otros y cuenta con la ventaja de que diariamente conoce nuevas personas a las que les puede ofrecer su mercancía, mejorando cada día sus ventas. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor como blusas, jeans, zapatos, accesorios, perfumería, entre otros, así podrá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en esta temporada; mejorando su nivel de ingresos.

Nelson, con empeño y dedicación, desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, ya que para un futuro cercano, sueña con tener la posibilidad de montar un almacén en un local comercial donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos y que le genere una rentabilidad y una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a sus hijos una excelente educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelson is single and the father of three children. For approximately 15 years, he has been working as an independent merchant. He learned this trade out of necessity through trial and error because he had to earn income to support his family. Nelson offers all types of products such as clothes, perfumes, body crèmes, accessories, and other items. One advantage that he has is that he comes into contact with new people each day, so he is able to offer them his merchandise and improve his sales.

Nelson is requesting the assistance of a loan so that he can buy merchandise in bulk such as blouses, jeans, shoes, accessories, perfumes, and other items. He will be able to restock with greater variety so that he can satisfy the increased demand during this season. In addition, he will be able to improve his level of earnings.

Nelson, with effort and dedication, wants to keep working so that he can get ahead in his business. In the near future, he dreams of having the opportunity to open a shop in a commercial center where he can offer a wider variety of products, become more profitable, and achieve financial stability so that he can provide his children an excellent education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, jeans, shoes, accessories, perfumes, and other merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen comes from a family of healers, artists, and entrepreneurs. This community has greatly influenced her interests and career. Two years ago, she decided to start a business that combined all of her passions. Through her fitness company, Karen works to empower and help people through movement and social connection. 

Originally from Brooklyn in New York City, Karen has lived in the US for her entire life. She financially supports her mother. Her greatest success with the business, she claims, has been her ability to improve the self-esteem and happiness of her clients by helping them lead healthier lives. However, she has run into the challenge of maintaining financial stability for her company. With this loan, Karen will be able to expand the services provided by her fitness business and take on more clients.

Karen believes that her business, dedicated to improving the physical and mental well-being of others, is her life’s calling. In the future, she hopes to connect the company to non-profit organizations and collaborate with other groups to have a greater positive impact.

Check out her website at www.warriorafterhours.com

loans.use: to expand services provided by her fitness business and take on more clients

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nimfa is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Nimfa has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle unit for her business.

Nimfa has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle unit for her business

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rickshaw transport business in the Philippines.

Ramona requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ramona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 24 years old and married with three children. She lives in a rural area outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She owns and operates a small general store in her community. She sells food items such as rice, cooking oil, canned food, biscuits and noodles in her store. She plans to restock her store with her loan.

She hopes to use the profits from her business to support her family's weekly expenses. Angela became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy new stock including rice, canned food, noodles and biscuits for her general store

loans.name: Raj

texts.en:
Raj, pictured here with her husband, Raja, is an artisan from India who specializes in gemstone inlay on marble. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of marble, as well as hire additional artisans to work at the family workshop.

Raj has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is her story:

Indian artisan Raj comes from Uttar Pradesh. "My parents arranged my marriage to Raja Ram Singh, and I love my husband very much," she says. "Since he is from Agra, I moved there. He worked in marble art and, after our children grew up, he began to teach me the art of marble carving. The Taj Mahal is a great source inspiration to us, and we try to replicate its beauty through our work. In our workshop, my husband I craft sculptures, jewelry boxes, coasters, trays and other designs."

"Having spent a lot of money on my recent illness, I'm finding it difficult to buy enough raw material or get artisans to join my workshop. This microcredit will help me get back on track and build up my business again."

Use the link below to view Raj's gemstone inlay on marble on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/6206

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of marble, as well as hire additional artisans to work at the family workshop.

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang is a 21-year-old single freshman who is from the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a Bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting at a university in the province. Her father is a rice farmer and her mother is a cleaner. 

Currently, Sreyneang would like to request a loan because she needs finances to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year. With the loan, she will be able to earn a Bachelor’s degree successfully. As for her future dreams, she hopes to have a good job in a financial institution with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand and gravel to improvement the entrance of her house.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 51 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, cooking oil, canned goods, candies, biscuits, cereals, etc., to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, cooking oil, canned goods, candies, biscuits, cereals, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, cooking oil, canned goods, candies, biscuits, cereals, etc., to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 53 years old and married with one child. For the past two years, she has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, noodles, detergent, soap, shampoo, candies, and other medicine. Thelma works very hard to provide for her family.

Thelma is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es: A sus 37 años de edad Carmen  esta casada, tiene un hijo de 13 años que asiste a la escuela, una hija de 15 años que esta en el colegio y la menor de 11 años que tiene discapacidad y asiste a un centro de rehabilitación, el esposo de Carmen  trabaja de empleado en cosecha de flores una planta florícola, Carmen se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, Carmen trabaja cuidando a personas de la tercera edad, Carmen necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar pollos que los tiene en un corral que elaboro junto a la casa de su suegra, Carmen tiene la aspiración de seguir adelante en su negocio y lo que mas anhela en su vida es que su hija se recupere y llegue a ser una niña normal.
texts.en:
At age 37, Carmen is married and has a 13-year-old son who is in school, a 15-year-old daughter who is in secondary school, and an 11-year-old daughter who has a disability and attends a center of rehabilitation.  Carmen’s husband works as an employee harvesting flowers in a flower factory while Carmen works raising young animals.  Carmen works caring for older people.  

Carmen needs the money from this loan to buy chickens, which she keeps in a corral built next to her mother-in-law’s home.  Carmen has aspirations of getting her business ahead; what she longs for most in life is that her daughter would get better and have a normal childhood.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 15 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling fish. Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Yolanda is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 50-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. For the past five years, she has operated a broom-making business in the Philippines. Delia is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Delia is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy bamboo sticks and other supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bamboo sticks and other supplies

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 38 years old and is married with eight children. Six of her children are in school. For the past two years, Teofila has run a business selling coconut shells in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teofila is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of coconut shells to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coconut shell to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 46 years old married with eight children. She lives in a rural community on the island of Guadalcanal. For the past year, Grace has been running a small business selling ice cake in her community.

Grace is requesting a 3,000 SBD loan to buy a new cooler, sugar, and flavor mixes to supply her business. She plans to use the profit from her loan to continue to improve her business and help cover her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, sugar, and flavor mixes for her ice cake business.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela esta cruzando por sus 27 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 4 años y ya asiste a la escuela, Gabriela se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, Gabriela con el dinero dl crédito va a comprar chanchos para tenerlos en chancheras, Gabriela comenta que por falta de recursos económicos no pudo seguir sus estudios y dice que desea que le vaya bien en su negocio para tener ingresos para cubrir los gastos de  educación de su hija para que ella si pueda terminar sus estudios, Gabriela va a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de chanchos y espera que le siga yendo bien en este negocio para que e permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija.
texts.en: Gabriela is cruising along at the age of 27. She is a single mother and has a 4 year old daughter who is already in school. Gabriela works raising small animals. Gabriela will use the money from the loan to buy pigs to keep in her enclosures. Gabriela mentioned that she couldn't continue her studies for want of economic resources. She says that she wants things to go well with her business in order to have the income to cover the cost of education for her daughter so that she can complete her studies. Gabriela will invest the money in buying pigs so that she can improve the quality of living for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Norbelyn

texts.en:
Norbelyn, 41, is a married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

For the past two years, Norbelyn has been running a fishing business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies. Norbelyn successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Norbelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Ziyagul

texts.ru: Зиягул, 40 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Зиягул среднее образование, уже 20 лет она занимается земледелием и животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Зиягул есть земельный участок мерою 1,7 Га, где она выращивает ячмень и есть 2 коровы, лошадь и 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход Зиягул составляет в среднем 25,000 сомов (KGS). Зиягул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит дойную корову для увеличения поголовья и объемов реализации экологически чистого, домашнего молока. Доходы от кредита позволят Зиягул увеличить ее хозяйство и построить сараи для скота.
texts.en:
Ziyagul is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children. Ziyagul has a secondary education, and she has been farming and raising animals for 20 years. Ziyagul's farm currently has a 1.7 hectare plot of land, where she grows barley and has 2 cows, a horse, and 10 sheep. Her monthly income averages 25,000 som (KGS). 

Ziyagul has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS), with which she will purchase a dairy cow to increase the size of her herd and her volume of sales of organic, farm-fresh milk. Ziyagul will use the proceeds from her loan to enlarge her farm and build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow to increase organic milk sales

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 52 years old and married with four children. Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, cooking oil, spices, bread, and other personal care products. Virginia has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. Virginia aspires to save money and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, cooking oil, spices, bread, and other personal care products

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old and single with three children. With two children presently in school, Arlene works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, noodles, spices, etc.  She has been in this business for three years.

Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Villarina

texts.en:
Villarina is a widow with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Villarina is 66 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Villarina has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Villarina requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy stock of ready-to-wear items to sell like pants, shorts, bags, t-shirts, and other products of ready-to-wear.

Villarina has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock of ready-to-wear items to sell like pants, shorts, bags, and t-shirts

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru: Майрам, 57 лет, замужем, мать троих детей. Образование у Майрам среднее, много лет она занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец. Также Майрам шьет национальные изделия, одежды для невест в качестве приданного. Совокупный доход составляет до 20,000 (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса, Майрам решила обратиться в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку материала для шитья. На прибыль от кредита она планирует и дальше развивать свою деятельность и хочет построить сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Mairam is 57 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Mairam has a secondary education, and for many years she has worked in agriculture, especially raising animals. She has 2 cows and 10 sheep on her farm. Mairam also sews traditional goods and clothing for brides for their weddings. Her total income is 20,000 (KGS) per month. 

In order to further develop her business, Mairam decided to approach Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase of fabric for sewing. With the proceeds from her loan, she plans to both further develop her business and build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy cloth and materials for sewing traditional goods.

loans.name: Eledita

texts.en:
Eledita is 58 years old, married and has four children.

Eledita is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. Eledita has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Meena is an artisan from India who specializes in wall hangings and handbags. She would like to hire additional artisans to work at her workshop.

Meena has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is her story:

India textile artist Meena says "I learned my art from my mother. My husband himself is an artist, so he helps me a great deal in designing. We have other artisans who assist us, and we are currently developing new styles for the contemporary interior. In the future, we would like to create an international niche for our designs."

"I want to do so much more but get restricted because my work is so labor intensive. I would like to get more helping hands and work a lot more for a bright future for my children."

Use the link below to view Meena's wall hangings and handbags on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4281

loans.use: to hire additional artisans to work at her workshop

loans.name: Gulam

texts.en:
Gulam is an artisan from India who specializes in soapstone candleholders and home decor. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of soapstone.

He comes from a family with a long relationship with the art of sculpting marble. Gulam has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"I became interested in this rich work and started helping my father in his work. He was honored with the State Award for Excellence in marble sculpting in 1979. After working with my father for a long time, I ventured out on my own. I experimented with different designs and gave a new dimension to the traditional styles. I have been honored with a State Award for Excellence in marble handicrafts."

"I have not been able to work at my capacity because of lack of raw material availability throughout the year. It will help so much to get good quality stone in bulk at good prices. That way I'll be able to keep my customers happy."

Use the link below to view Gulam's soapstone candleholders and home decor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4612

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of soapstone

loans.name: Suresh

texts.en:
Suresh is an artisan from India who specializes in reclaimed wood sculptures. He would like to invest in new equipment for his workshop, including a work bench.

Suresh has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

"I am from a hill station, Uttranchal, and I have always been a wanderer, and always spent my time wandering in the jungle. I just love its beauty – the trees, the rivers, the ponds. Fallen trees that form bridges over the streams, the chirping of birds and the sun rays peeking through the thick mass of trees delight me. One day I noticed an old sculpture my uncle had made. It was all roughly colored, but there was something interesting about the piece. I removed the paint and modified it using and it came out really well. I started collecting found wood from the jungle and sculpting it into unique pieces of art. When I go wood-hunting to the river and jungle, I become one with nature. It is such a peaceful ambiance and I thank God for the blessing and talent he has bestowed on me. Another reason why I love my work is that it does not harm our eco system. I have never cut any trees or parts of them to create my sculptures. I love nature and there can be no better way to tell the world that, but through my art."

"With growing age I find it difficult to sit on the floor and work. It'll help me a lot to get a work bench so that I can work more comfortably and happily."

Use the link below to view Suresh's reclaimed wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5086

loans.use: to invest in new equipment for his workshop, including a work bench

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran is an artisan from India who specializes in marble boxes and decorative plates. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of marble as well as make improvements to his workshop.

Imran has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

India's Imran comes from Agra, home of the Taj Mahal. "My family has a very long association with the art of marble and other handicrafts," he says. "Although other family members worked with marble, my father won awards for his carpet weaving work. When I was 16, I joined my family in marble art and learned from my uncle. The stone is exquisite and beautiful, and we create wonderful and innovative designs featuring fine gemstone inlay."

"The difference in raw material costs in the open market and at the quarry is vast. I'll be able to make so many more new things with better sourcing of raw material but need money to make a bulk purchase. This microcredit will help me realize my dream of selling my creations to the farthest corners of the world."

Use the link below to view Imran 's marble boxes and decorative plates on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5647

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of marble as well as make improvements to his workshop

loans.name: Pires

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo tem 26 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 1filho menor de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua sobrinha que vive em casa da sua mãe.
Trabalhador a 7 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Enfrentando dificuldades para erguer a sua  residência solícita um empréstimo para dar continuidade a sua obra adquirindo material de construção como: chapas, barrotes, pranchas e cimento. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende reabrir o seu estabelecimento comercial de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade, terminar a sua residência e garantir o ensino do seu filho até ao nível superior. O seu maior desafio é terminar a sua residência para dar conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Pires comes from Namaacha, province of Maputo. He's 26 years old and married. He has an underage son and takes care of his niece who lives with his mother.
He has been in the workforce for seven years and earns an income which he uses for household expenses. Since he's been struggling to build his house, he requests a loan so that he can move forward with the construction work by purchasing construction supplies such as metal plates, beams, planks and cement. This is his 4th loan with Hluvuku.
In the future he intends to reopen his store where he sold products that are household staples. He also intends to finish his house and ensure that his son gets an education all the way to college. His biggest challenge is finishing his home in order to provide comfort for his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as metal plates, beams, planks and cement.

loans.name: Elina

texts.pt:
Senhora Elina tem 56 anos de idade, é solteira e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais sustenta 2 frequentando ensino secundário, é negociante a de 12 anos, vive em casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de arroz, açúcar bolachas, sumos amendoim, sal para revender na sua mercearia.
No futuro prende ampliar o negócio vendendo os produtos a grosso como forma de ajudar as comunidades vizinhas e criar postos de emprego para os jovens.
O seu grande desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora, e poupar dinheiro para garantir o sustento escolar dos filhos até fazerem a licenciatura.
texts.en:
Elina is 56 years old and single. She has six children and she supports two of them who are in high school. She has been a vendor for over 12 years. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase rice, sugar, crackers, juice, peanuts and salt for re-selling in her grocery store.
In the future she intends to expand her business by selling wholesale merchandise as a way of helping neighboring communities and creating jobs for young people.
Her biggest challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency and saving money in order to ensure that her children get an education all the way to a college degree.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, crackers, juice, peanuts and salt for re-selling in her grocery store.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita, 26, is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

For the past ten years, Amelita has been operating a food vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more pigs for her business. In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for her food vending business

loans.name: Anabelia

texts.en:
Anabelia, 26, is married and has three children, one of whom is in school. 

For the past six years, Anabelia has been raising pigs in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. This will be Anabelia's second loan with NWTF.

In the future, Anabelia would like to save enough money to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia, 45, is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. 

For the past ten years, Clemencia has been raising pigs in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. This will be her seventh loan with NWTF.

Moving forward, Clemencia would like to save enough money to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is sixty years old and married.

For the past five years, Cristina has been raising pigs in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF.

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Vitoria

texts.pt:
Senhora Vitoria tem 30 anos de idade, é casada e tem uma filha menor, trabalha como caixa de um super mercado, vive em casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de sanita, chuveiro, azulejos, para dar continuidade a construção do quarto de banho da sua casa,
No futuro pretende abrir uma mercearia de modo a arrecadar mais fundos para complementar o salário que não chega para custear as despesas da casa.
O seu maior desafio é de poupar fundos para aquisição de meio de transporte para o transporte pessoal visto está cada vês mais difícil depender de transporte publico nesta cidade.
texts.en:
Vitoria is 30 years old and married. She has an underage daughter and works as a cashier for a supermarket. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase a toilet, a shower and tiles so she can continue building a bathroom in her house.
In the future she intends to open a grocery store as a way of raking in more funds to complement her salary, which is not enough to afford her household expenses.
Her biggest challenge is saving money to buy a means of transportation for personal use, since it's becoming increasingly difficult to depend on public transportation in her town.

loans.use: to purchase a toilet, a shower and tiles so she can continue building a bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom is a 29-year-old married factory worker with a small child in her care. She is from the Kandal province of Cambodia. She has worked in the factory since 2007. Her husband is a 25-year-old rice farmer.

Sreymom and her husband can make approximately $6.50 per day. She has decided to take out a loan because she needs money to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell, and also for plowing. With this loan she will be able to have enough money to buy a cow.

In the future, she wants to save money to buy more farmland and to help her child earn a high education.

loans.use: to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell, and also for plowing.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.pt:
Senhora Esmeralda tem 33 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 3 filhos menores dos quais uma estuda frequentado ensino primário, e outros sem idade escolar, é avicultora e vive em casa própria e sustenta a mãe.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de pintos e rações para a produção de frangos e posterior revenda no mercado local.
Criando frangos contribui na dieta alimentar dos residentes da sua comunidade, assim sendo no futuro pretende ampliar os seus aviários de modo a criar em grandes quantidades para fornecer os super mercados e outras comunidades bem como criar emprego para outros jovens.
O seu maior desafio é de manter o controlo nos seus aviários visto que trata se de uma actividade de grande risco, para que não perca a produção, e consequentemente ter problemas de reembolso.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 33 years old and married. She has three underage children, a daughter who attends elementary school and two other children who are below school age. She's a poultry farmer who lives in a house that she owns. She supports her mother.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase chicks and feed for raising chickens and then re-selling them at the local market.
Raising chickens contributes toward feeding the people who live in her community. That's why in the future she intends to expand her chicken farm so that she can breed them in large quantities. That way she can supply them to supermarkets and other communities and also create jobs for other young people.
Her biggest challenge is keeping control of her chicken farm, since it's a high risk business. She needs to do that to avoid facing production loss and therefore have problems repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and feed for raising chickens and then re-selling them at the local market.

loans.name: Alin

texts.en:
Alin is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alin is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Alin has a native basket weaving business in the Philippines. Alin requested a 10,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her business .

Alin has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Alin would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her native basket weaving business.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 48 years old and married with six children. Tita works very hard to provide for them.

Tita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, bread, cooking oil, milk, coffee, sugar, juice, soft drinks, etc.

Tita has been in this business for three years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, bread, cooking oil, milk, coffee, sugar, juice, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Josielinda

texts.en:
Josielinda is 45 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Josielinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. These include canned goods, shampoo, noodles, milk, coffee, soft drinks and other personal care products. Josielinda has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 45-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Alma has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods and personal care products. Alma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, personal care products, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina, 48, is a native from Talibon, Bohol. She earns a living by providing tricycle transportation services. Divina is married and has three dependents and her youngest child is 20. 

Divina has been engaged in her transportation business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to pay the tricycle franchise and for maintenance fees, which are needed to continue operating her business.  With this loan, she can set aside some money and start expanding her transportation services.

She hopes that her business will be successful in the years to come.

loans.use: to pay for tricycle franchise and its maintenance

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 39 years old and has four children. Delia is married and three of her children are in school.

Delia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Delia has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 43 years old, married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Alona has a food production business in the Philippines. Alona requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Alona has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Alona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ella is 57 years old and has three children who are presently in school.

Ella has a buy & sell newspapers business in the Philippines. Ella requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more newspapers to sell to her customers.

Ella has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more newspapers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Leydy

texts.es:
Leydy es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia:
Mi nombre es Leydy, soy de La Romana, tengo 31 años y vivo con mis padres, somos 6 hermanos. Mi padre trabaja como pescador de caña, mi madre es ama de casa.
Yo estoy estudiando medicina en la Universidad Central del Este, en San Pedro de Macorís, ya he cursado 7 periodos, me faltan 5 más para terminar mi carrera. 
Mi familia no tiene dinero para pagarme la matriculas de medicina, porque esta carrera ha aumentado mucho y no pueden ya ayudarme con todo lo que necesito. Yo quiero terminar esta carrera porque siempre ha sido mi sueño, por tal razón estoy solicitando este préstamo para poder pagar mi matricula, si no consigo este préstamo no voy a poder estudiar  y tendré que ponerme a trabajar.  Si me aprueban este préstamo voy a estudiar mucho más para poder graduarme y conseguir un buen trabajo en mi país, ayúdenme a lograr mi sueño.
texts.en:
Leydy is a young medicine student; she is asking for a loan in order to cover her education costs.  This is her story:

My name is Leydy and I am from La Romana.  I am 31 years old and live with my parents.  There are six of us siblings.  My father works as an angler and my mother is a housewife.  

I am studying medicine at the "Universidad Central del Este" in San Pedro de Macoris.  I have finished seven terms, but I need five more in order to finish my studies.  My family does not have money to pay for my medical school tuition because this course has increased a lot and they are not able to help me with everything I need.  

I want to finish my studies because it has always been my dream.  For this reason I am asking for a loan so that I am able to pay my tuition.  If I do not get this loan I will not be able to study and I will have to start working.  If I am approved for the loan I am going to study a lot more in order to graduate and get a good job in my country.  Help me achieve my dream.

loans.use: to cover the costs of higher education.

loans.name: Zoila Monserrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno aun vive con ella y estudia universidad. Su esposo realiza transporte de personal para una empresa particular.
Doña Zoila  es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y así lograr sus propios ingresos que le sirvan para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella desde hace mas de 5 años trabaja todos las tardes y noches en un pequeño local que ella arrienda frente al mar el cual por su ubicación es adecuado para el negocio de comidas rápidas, ella prepara deliciosas hamburguesas, hot dog, papas, fritas, tostadas, batidos de frutas, gaseosas, entre otras cosas. Desde que recibe la ayuda de los créditos ella ha mejorado mucho su local y su vida por eso está muy agradecida con las personas que hacen posible los créditos ya que para ella son una bendición. 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar mesas y sillas ya que las que tiene están un poco deterioradas y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva más de más de 9 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The members of the Crucita Credit Group meet in Crucita Parish in the Portoviejo Canton, a locality known for its beautiful beaches, which surround this lovely place, and are much visited by domestic and international tourists.  It is known by the name “Crucita la Bella” [Crucita the beautiful].

Zoila lives here.  She is 54 years old, and she is married, with four grown children from this relationship. One is still living with her and studying in the university. Her husband is a chauffeur for a private company.

Zoila is a woman who likes to work, and in this way, earn her own income that will serve to help her husband with the household expenses.   For five years, she has been working every afternoon and evening in a small store that she rents on the oceanfront.  Because of its location, it is suitable for a fast food business. She prepares delicious hamburgers, hot dogs, potatoes, fries, tostadas, fruit smoothies, and soft drinks, among other things.

She has improved her store and her life very much since she has been receiving the loans. That is why she is very grateful to the people who make the loans possible, as they are a blessing for her. She is going to use this loan to purchase tables and chairs—as the ones that she has are dilapidated—and supplies for the preparation of the food.  

She has been in the credit group for more than nine years, and she likes it for the help that the loans provide. Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs, and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to support new product and software development.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 41 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Analiza works very hard to provide for them.

Analiza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries.

In the future Analiza would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wennifreda

texts.en:
Wennifreda is 41 years old and has two children. Wennifreda is married and her children are currently in school.

Wennifreda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Wennifreda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Wennifreda has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain them.

She would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Carlosa

texts.en:
Carlosa is 51 years old, married and has three children. One of her children is in school.

Carlosa is in the agricultural business, raising goats in the Philippines. Carlosa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her goats.

Carlosa has been raising goats for ten years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Carlosa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her goats.

loans.name: Aillen

texts.en:
Aillen, 34, is a married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

For the past six years, Aillen has operated a general store business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, including canned goods and personal care products.

In the future, Aillen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita, 29, is a married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

For the past two years, Charlita has run a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Charlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es: Don Carlos nació en una comunidad llamada llano redondo en el año de 1976,estudió hasta  cuarto grado luego no pudo seguir estudiando ya que los padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y decidió ayudarle al padre en labores de agricultura. Actualmente esta casado y tiene 2 hijos,Carlos comenta que apoyara a sus hijos hasta donde  pueda, El y su familia  se dedican a la siembra de granos básicos y poco a poco con mucho esfuerzo compró un sistema solar ya que en esta comunidad no hay luz eléctrica pero actualmente están en mal estado algunos accesorios, comenta que antes de obtener este sistema solar se tenía que estar alumbrando con foco y con candela pero cuando obtuvo el panel solar todo fue diferente, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de estos equipos que están en mal estado, y volver a tener luz en su casa de habitación ya que la luz es bastante importante para realizar labores en el hogar su hija hace los trabajos que le dejan en clase, y estaría agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de estos accesorios.
texts.en: Carlos was born in a community called Llano Redondo in 1976. He went to school up to the fourth grade. After that, he wasn't able to keep going to school because his parents were of low income. He decided to help his father with the farm work. Now he is married and has 2 children. Carlos says that he will support his children as much as he can. He and his family grow basic grains and little by little, with a lot of effort, he has bought a solar power system. In this community, there is no electricity. Some of the accessories are in poor condition. He says that before he obtained this solar system he had to use a flashlight and a candle for light. When he obtained the solar panel everything was different. That is why he is asking for a loan to buy this equipment that are in poor condition, and have light again in his house.
